text.text: Ransomware Could Be Major Threat to 2020 Election (Info Security, Sep 08) US/Global - Ransomware could pose a significant threat to the US election infrastructure, as aging software and potentially vulnerable voting machines could be targeted by criminal elements or by foreign-based cyber-attacks. According to NTT Ltd.’s global threat report (https://hello.global.ntt/en-us/insights) , ransomware could be deployed and lay in wait to be activated on election day, posing a significant threat to voting processes and procedures, potentially bringing voting operations to a halt.- Sources : https://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/news/ransomware-2020-election/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Ransomware Could Be Major Threat to 2020 Election - Infosecurity Magazine

text.text: Hybrid physical-cyber security threats drive supplier integration (IT Security Guru, Sep 08) Global - As the cyber and physical worlds collide and interact, defences in each are now integrating. A recent example being the merger between Jazz Networks, a cybersecurity firm, and Vaion, an end-to-end video security provider to form Ava Security. Tormod Ree, CEO of Ava Security commented: “The only way to protect against hybrid cyber and physical security threats is to have a solution that can connect the dots across both domains.”- Sources : https://www.itsecurityguru.org/2020/09/08/hybrid-physical-cyber-security-threats-drive-supplier-integration/?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=hybrid-physical-cyber-security-threats-drive-supplier-integration
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Hybrid physical-cyber security threats drive supplier integration - IT Security Guru

text.text: Rate of Ransomware Attacks in Healthcare Slows in H1 2020 (Dark Reading, June 11) Global - Corvus Insurance claims that "despite a significant and steady rise in ransomware attacks over the past few years, attacks on healthcare entities have actually stalled in 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic, [a] possible reflection of claims by many ransomware groups that they would avoid attacks on healthcare entities during COVID-19" according to Lauren Winchester.- Sources : https://www.darkreading.com/attacks-breaches/rate-of-ransomware-attacks-in-healthcare-slows-in-h1-2020/d/d-id/1338051
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-None

text.text: Chris Morales, head of security analytics at Vectra, says Corvus' finding tracks with what his own company has observed in recent months: "We have seen no increase in external attacks against healthcare this year."- Sources : https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fake-black-lives-matter-voting-campaign-spreads-trickbot-malware/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Fake Black Lives Matter voting campaign spreads Trickbot malware

text.text: Fake Black Lives Matter voting campaign spreads Trickbot malware (Bleeping Computer, June 10) US - A phishing email campaign asking you to vote anonymously about Black Lives Matter is spreading the TrickBot information-stealing malware. Threat actors commonly utilize current events as lures to trick people into opening their malicious emails, as is the case with this campaign discovered by cybersecurity organization Abuse.ch that pretends to be from "Country administration," asking recipients to 'Vote anonymous about "Black Lives Matter".- Sources : https://www.anomali.com/blog/anomali-threat-research-identifies-fake-covid-19-contact-tracing-apps-used-to-monitor-devices-steal-personal-data
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Anomali Threat Research Identifies Fake COVID-19 Contact Tracing Apps Used to Download Malware that Monitors Devices, Steals Personal Data | Anomali

text.text: AP Exclusive: Police officers’ personal info leaked online (The Washington Post, June 11) US - Personal information of police officers in departments nationwide is being leaked online according to a document by the US Department of Homeland Security. The document warns that doxxing efforts could lead to attacks by “violent opportunists or domestic violent extremists” or could prevent law enforcement officials from carrying out their duties. Multiple high-ranking police officials have had their personal information shared online, including home & email addresses and phone numbers.- Sources : https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/courts_law/ap-exclusive-police-officers-personal-info-leaked-online/2020/06/10/e6484de6-ab46-11ea-a43b-be9f6494a87d_story.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-The Washington Post

text.text: Palestinians might carry out cyberattacks in response to annexation (Jerusalem Times, June 11) Israel/Palestine - Palestinians might try to carry out cyberattacks against Israeli targets should Israel follow through on its plans to annex the West Bank and Jordan Valley. While it’s not the number one threat, Yuval Diskin, the former head of Israel’s internal security agency warned that it’s a threat that the defense establishment should prepare for.- Sources : https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/palestinians-might-carry-out-cyberattacks-in-response-to-annexation-631075
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Palestinians might carry out cyberattacks in response to annexation - The Jerusalem Post

text.text: Anomali Threat Research Identifies Fake COVID-19 Contact Tracing Apps Used to Download Malware that Monitors Devices, Steals Personal Data (Anomali, June 11) Global - Threat actors are distributing fake Android applications themed around official government COVID-19 contact tracing apps. Anomali Threat Research found multiple applications, designed to download and install malware to monitor infected devices, and to steal banking credentials and personal data.- Sources : https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/06/10/1002934/protest-propaganda-is-riding-on-the-success-of-pandemic-hoaxes/?truid=26ed320dce9b06b5f4e661f524e2c698&utm_source=the_download&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=the_download.unpaid.engagement&utm_term=subs&utm_content=06-11-2020
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Protest misinformation is riding on the success of pandemic hoaxes | MIT Technology Review

text.text: Zoom closed account of U.S.-based Chinese activist “to comply with local law” (Axios, June 10) US/China - The US video-conferencing company Zoom closed the account of a group of prominent US-based Chinese activists after they held a Zoom event commemorating the anniversary of the June 04 Tiananmen Square Massacre. A Zoom spokesperson confirmed to Axios that the account had been closed "to comply with local law" and said it had now been re-activated. Zoom has faced growing scrutiny over security concerns and its ties to China.- Sources :
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: Germany Seeks EU Sanctions for 2015 Cyberattack on Its Parliament (The Wall Street Journal, June 11) Germany/Russia - Germany is urging EU governments to impose the bloc’s first-ever sanctions for hacking on a Russian suspect in the 2015 cyberattack on the German parliament. An EU sanctions framework for cyberattacks took effect last year, allowing the imposition of travel bans to and the freezing of bank accounts in the EU. To impose sanctions, however, all EU governments must agree to do so.- Sources : https://www.wsj.com/articles/germany-seeks-eu-sanctions-for-2015-cyberattack-on-its-parliament-11591867801
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Amazon pauses police use of its facial recognition tech for a year (Reuters, June 10) US - Amazon is implementing a one-year moratorium on police use of its facial recognition software, halting a business it long defended. The decision culminates a two-year battle between Amazon and civil liberties activists, who are concerned that inaccurate matches could lead to unjust arrests. The death of George Floyd has fanned worries that facial recognition would be used unfairly against protesters.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-com-facial-recognition/amazon-pauses-police-use-of-its-facial-recognition-tech-for-a-year-idUSKBN23H3EO?feedType=RSS&feedName=technologyNews
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- Amazon pauses police use of its facial recognition tech for a year - Reuters

text.text: Facebook turned to hacking to help FBI catch a child predator (CNET, June 10) US - Facebook helped the FBI unmask a man, repeatedly harassing and exploiting girls on the social network. Buster Hernandez had been using the secure operating system Tails, which hid his real IP address. Working with a third-party firm, Facebook developed a hacking tool to reveal Hernandez's real IP address. The tool was given to an intermediary, who handed it over to the FBI.- Sources : https://www.cnet.com/news/facebook-turned-to-hacking-to-help-the-fbi-catch-a-child-predator/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Facebook turned to hacking to help FBI catch a child predator - CNET

text.text: CYBEREASON’S NEWEST HONEYPOT SHOWS HOW MULTISTAGE RANSOMWARE ATTACKS SHOULD HAVE CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE PROVIDERS ON HIGH ALERT (Cybereason, June 11) Global - Cybereason launched a honeypot to analyze TTPs of state-sponsored groups and cybercriminals to target critical infrastructure. The honeypot, built to look like an electricity company in North America and Europe, lured multiple ransomware attackers in just 3 days. Given the operational attack pattern, Cybereason concludes that multistage ransomware attacks on critical infrastructure are increasingly dangerous and more prevalent.- Sources : https://www.cybereason.com/blog/cybereason-honeypot-multistage-ransomware
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Cybereason\xe2\x80\x99s Newest Honeypot Shows How Multistage Ransomware Attacks Should Have Critical Infrastructure Providers on High Alert

text.text: Norway's parliament says it was hit by 'significant' cyber attack (Reuters, Sep 01) Norway - According to  the national assembly and a counter-intelligence agency, the Norwegian parliament suffered a "significant" cyberattack during the past week as the e-mail accounts of several elected members and employees were hacked. It was not known who was behind the attack or exactly what data had been extracted.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-norway-parliament-idUSKBN25S587
text.headline: ASSISTANCE- Norway\'s parliament says it was hit by \'significant\' cyber attack - Reuters

text.text: Chinese Hackers Targeted European Officials in Phishing Campaign (Bloomberg, Sep 01) China/Europe  - Chinese APT TA413 targeted European officials, diplomats, non-profits, and other organizations to gather intelligence about global economies reeling from the pandemic. Emails mimicking the WHO’s Covid-19 guidance attempted to lure victims into clicking on an attachment containing Sepulcher malware. The same malware was discovered in a phishing campaign in July targeting Tibetan dissidents, which the TA413 hacker group is best known for targeting.- Sources : https://www.bnnbloomberg.ca/chinese-hackers-targeted-european-officials-in-phishing-campaign-1.1488344
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Chinese Hackers Targeted European Officials in Phishing Campaign -  BNN Bloomberg

text.text: Russians Again Targeting Americans With Disinformation, Facebook and Twitter Say (New York Times, Sep 01) US/Russia - The Russian Internet Research Agency (IRA) that interfered in the 2016 elections is using a network of fake accounts and a website set up to look like a left-wing news site. Intelligence agencies have warned that Russia was actively trying to disrupt the November election by feeding conspiracy theories to alienate Americans. Now Facebook and Twitter are offering evidence of this meddling. The White House in recent weeks has sought to downplay Russian interference.- Sources : https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/01/technology/facebook-russia-disinformation-election.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Facebook and Twitter Say Russians Are Again Targeting Americans With Disinformation - The New York Times

text.text: Experts warn: High-tech tools to fight COVID-19 pose their own risks (Reuters, Sep 01) Europe - A range of technologies designed to combat the spread of COVID-19 is being deployed across Europe, from tracking apps to infrared cameras, posing a threat to individual digital rights and privacy, a report by AlgorithmWatch (a digital rights group) warned. Using such tools, despite the urgency surrounding the pandemic, calls for proper oversight and should not be rushed.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-technology/experts-warn-high-tech-tools-to-fight-covid-19-pose-their-own-risks-idUSKBN25S3X1
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- Experts warn: High-tech tools to fight COVID-19 pose their own risks - Reuters

text.text: Microsoft rolls out tools to spot disinformation, deepfakes (The Hindu, Sep 02) Global - Microsoft announced (https://blogs.microsoft.com/on-the-issues/2020/09/01/disinformation-deepfakes-newsguard-video-authenticator/) tools to identify manipulated videos and photos. The tools are part of the company’s programme to help protect voting through ElectionGuard, a feature to verify and secure campaigns ahead of US elections. Microsoft’s Video Authenticator can analyse a video  in real-time or a still photo to provide a percentage chance, or confidence score, that the media is artificially manipulated.- Sources : https://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/technology/microsoft-launches-new-tools-to-detect-disinformation-deepfake/article32502852.ece
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Beyond Secret Cyber Deals, Israel and UAE Ties May Be a Boon for AI (Haaretz, Sep 01) Israel/UAE - The recent normalization of relations between Israel and the UAE sparked interest in the potential cooperation on a wide range of issues. While the Israeli government and companies have  secretly been selling (https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/business/.premium-israeli-high-tech-firms-make-good-money-in-dubai-but-don-t-want-to-talk-about-it-1.9085980)  cyber-related technology to the Gulf states, there's another field that could bring cooperation into the forefront of technological development – artificial intelligence.- Sources :
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Babylon Health data breach: GP app users able to see other people's consultations (The Guardian, June 10) UAE - Babylon Health has suffered a data breach involving confidential patient information, with users of its GP video consultation app allowed to see other patients’ appointments. Babylon later said that the problem was a limited software error and not a “malicious attack”.- Sources : https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2020/jun/10/babylon-health-data-breach-gp-app-users-able-to-see-other-peoples-consultations
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Babylon Health data breach: GP app users able to see other people\'s consultations | UK news | The Guardian

text.text: UAE is 3rd most attractive target for cybercriminals (Khaleej Times, June 10) UAE - According to NordVPN's Cyber Risk Index, the UAE is the 3rd most attractive target for cybercriminals after Iceland and Sweden. Although these countries are better equipped for cybersecurity threats, their residents are more exposed to cybercriminals due to their greater use of digital banking and longer time spent on social media since global lockdown measures.- Sources : https://www.khaleejtimes.com/technology/uae-is-3rd-most-attractive-target-for-cybercriminals
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-UAE is 3rd most attractive target for cybercriminals - News | Khaleej Times

text.text: Maze Ransomware adds Ragnar Locker to its extortion cartel (Bleeping Computer, June 08) Global - Ragnar Locker has partnered with Maze Ransomware to use their data leak platform to extort victims. Last week, Lockbit Ransomware teamed up with Maze Ransomware (https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ransomware-gangs-team-up-to-form-extortion-cartel/)  to use its data leak platform and share intelligence to drive successful extortions, essentially creating a 'cartel' of ransomware operations with the aim to increase success of attacks. Maze ransomware told BleepingComputer that Ragnar Locker would be joining with others in discussion to join at a later time.- Sources : https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/maze-ransomware-adds-ragnar-locker-to-its-extortion-cartel/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Maze Ransomware adds Ragnar Locker to its extortion cartel

text.text: Russian intelligence working to destabilize southern Ukraine – expert (UNIAN, June 10) Ukraine/Russia - Ukraine is accusing Russia of information operations across southern Ukraine, encouraging residents to acquire Russian, Romanian, or Moldovan citizenship, in an alleged effort to create prerequisites for secessionism. The effort includes a front organization in Moldova, assisting Ukrainians in obtaining other citizenships. The operation will likely be accompanied by attempts to aggravate Ukrainian-Romanian relations, a Ukrainian security official said.- Sources : https://www.unian.info/politics/russian-intelligence-working-to-destabilize-southern-ukraine-expert-11030441.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Russian intelligence working to destabilize southern Ukraine \xe2\x80\x93 expert \xe2\x80\x94 UNIAN

text.text: House Intelligence Committee chairman wants to know whether Pentagon spy agency provided information on protesters (The Washington Post, June 09) US - The House Intelligence Committee asked the Pentagon whether any combat-support intelligence agency has been used to provide information to law enforcement responding to nationwide protests. The letter from Rep. Adam Schiff sought assurance that the Pentagon was not providing such support, including to track protesters.- Sources : https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/house-intelligence-committee-chairman-wants-to-know-whether-pentagon-spy-agency-provided-information-on-protesters/2020/06/08/488fa256-a9c6-11ea-a9d9-a81c1a491c52_story.html
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-comment

text.text: Facebook, Twitter, Google to report monthly on fake news fight, EU says (Reuters, June 10) EU - Amid reports of foreign disinformation on COVID-19,  EU officials are calling on social media giants to provide monthly reports on their fight against disinformation. The call was made by EU foreign policy head, Josep Borrell, and EC's Vice President for values and transparency, Vera Jourova, stating that “disinformation does not only harm the health of our democracies, it also harms the health of our citizens."- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-health-coronavirus-eu-disinfor/facebook-twitter-google-to-report-monthly-on-fake-news-fight-eu-says-idUSKBN23H1EH?feedType=RSS&feedName=technologyNews
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- Facebook, Twitter, Google to report monthly on fake news fight, EU says - Reuters

text.text: NATO chief says on Huawei: UK review of 5G security is important (Reuters, June 10) UK/China - NATO Secretary General, Stoltenberg, said that the West could not ignore the rise of China and so it was important that Britain had a review of the role of Huawei in its 5G network to ensure its security. When asked about these comments, China's foreign ministry spokeswomen said that China does not pose a threat to any country.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-huawei-nato/nato-chief-says-on-huawei-uk-review-of-5g-security-is-important-idUSKBN23H0US
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- NATO chief says on Huawei: UK review of 5G security is important - Reuters

text.text: Israel and Iran's latest round of cyberattacks threaten the unofficial rules of engagement (Business Insider, June 10) Israel/Iran - Iran and Israel have been engaging in tit-for-tat cyber operations, including an alleged attack on Israeli water facilities in April, aiming to increase chlorine levels in the water supply. Former Israeli national security advisor, Ya'akov Amidror described this is "crossing international red lines," marking the first time that Iran directly targeted Israeli civilians - not via proxies (cf. Hezbollah). Amidror says the move sets a dangerous precedent for the future of cyberwarfare.- Sources : https://www.businessinsider.com/israel-and-irans-yberattacks-threaten-unofficial-rules-of-engagement-2020-6?r=US&IR=T
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Chevron icon

text.text: Ransomware attacks spike by 140%, 57% of organizations agree to pay (Atlas VPN, June 09) Global - Atlas VPN reveals that the amounts of demanded ransom payments increased by 140% from 2018 to 2019. The percentage of companies agreeing to pay ransoms has also increased from 38% to 57% of organisations that were hit by ransomware in the last 12 months.- Sources : https://atlasvpn.com/blog/ransomware-attacks-spike-by-140-57-of-organizations-agree-to-pay
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Attack Surface Growing for Healthcare Industry (Security Week, July 01) Global - Vectra AI analyzed the network behavior of 363 opt-in enterprises across industries, detecting the mass movement of data out of data centers and into the cloud -- far more so with healthcare than other industries. It is feared that this migration to cloud-based tele-health services will leave the industry more exposed in the future.- Sources : https://www.securityweek.com/attack-surface-growing-healthcare-industry
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-None

text.text: U.S. Ambassador Says Moscow Likely To Meddle In Georgian Elections (RFERL, July 02) Russia/Georgia - US Ambassador to Georgia warns that Russia will likely try to interfere in the October parliamentary elections, pointing to a massive, allegedly Russian-organized cyebrattack on more than 2,000 Georgian websites in October 2019 as "a serious warning" for Georgia and other countries.- Sources : https://www.rferl.org/a/us-ambassador-says-moscow-likely-to-meddle-in-georgian-elections/30702617.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-U.S. Ambassador Says Moscow Likely To Meddle In Georgian Elections

text.text: The Public Chamber of the Russian Federation reported a DDoS attack on its website (E Hacking News, July 02) Russia - The website of the Russian Public Chamber and website "to fight fakes" - feikam[.]net, were hit by DDoS attacks, leaving them inaccessible. The attack comes amid Russia's vote on constitutional amendments, including the controversial changes that will allow Putin to remain in power until 2036.- Sources : https://www.ehackingnews.com/2020/07/the-public-chamber-of-russian.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-The Public Chamber of the Russian Federation reported a DDoS attack on its website - E Hacking News - Latest Hacker News and IT Security News

text.text: Saudi dissident sues Twitter over spying campaign and account suspension (Middle East Eye, July 01) Saudi Arabia/US - Saudi dissident, Ali al-Ahmed, filed a lawsuit against Twitter for failing to protect his account from being hacked and refusing to reinstating it. The suit alleges that Saudi spies infiltrated the company and accessed information on an array of Saudi dissidents. Last year, the US charged two Saudi nationals for accessing  and sharing data of over 6K Twitter users with Saudi officials.- Sources : https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/saudi-dissident-sues-twitter-over-account-suspension-and-espionage-campaign
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Hong Kongers erase digital footprints ahead of security laws (Nikkei Asian Review, June 29) Hong Kong/China - As the clock ticked toward the implementation of Beijing's new national security laws for Hong Kong, people in the territory rushed to alter their digital footprints or remove their presence entirely from social media, already triggering wide self-censorship. The new laws, which will outlaw activities of "separatism, subversion, terrorism and foreign interference" and follow last year's massive anti-government protests, have raised concerns among legal experts.- Sources : https://asia.nikkei.com/Politics/Hong-Kongers-erase-digital-footprints-ahead-of-security-laws
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Icon Twitter

text.text: Lawmakers call for more transparency in health agency's pandemic data collection practices (Washington Post, July 01) US - Democratic lawmakers are sounding the alarm about a program launched by the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to track the spread of the coronavirus. In a letter sent to HHS Secretary, a group of Democratic US senators called for more transparency around the initiative, questioning whether  the gathered data would be shared with US Immigration and Customs Enforcement to round up undocumented immigrants.- Sources : https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/07/01/warren-hhs-data-collection/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-comment

text.text: Experts: COVID Multiplying Risks To Critical Infrastructure (Forbes, July 01) Global - Former DHS Secretary, Michael Chertoff, warned that COVID is exacerbating the risk of crippling cyberattacks on critical infrastructure as it has enhanced countries’ reliance on digital technologies while highlighting the lack of coordination and cooperation between nations and critical industries. Chertoff also warned that hostile nations like Russia and China are increasingly relying on digital means to project power abroad.- Sources : https://www.forbes.com/sites/paulfroberts/2020/07/01/experts-covid-multiplying-risks-to-critical-infrastructure/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Experts: COVID Multiplying Risks To Critical Infrastructure

text.text: Rights activists raise alarm over Israeli cellphone hacking tech sold to Belarus (Times of Israel, Aug 19) Belarus/Israel - The Israeli firm, Cellebrite, which bragged that its products can help law enforcement break into the majority of smartphones is alleged to have provided its technology to Belarus, raising fears it is being used against the opposition to long-time dictator, Lukashenko.- Sources : https://www.timesofisrael.com/rights-activists-raise-alarm-over-israeli-cellphone-hacking-tech-sold-to-belarus/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Rights activists raise alarm over Israeli cellphone hacking tech sold to Belarus | The Times of Israel

text.text: Samaritan Medical Center restores Electronic Medical Records System following malware attack (NNY 360, Aug 18) US - Following a malware attack, Samaritan Medical Center restored its Electronic Medical Records application, accounting and payroll systems. This enables hospital staff to resume regular processes for electronic patient registration, hospital scheduling, and patient records utilization. Patient records were recorded manually while the hospital operated on down-time procedures.- Sources : https://www.nny360.com/communitynews/healthmatters/samaritan-medical-center-restores-electronic-medical-records-system-following-malware-attack/article_ec27c444-8ddb-5e85-b3a5-e506cc5b853b.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Samaritan Medical Center restores Electronic Medical Records System following malware attack | Health Matters | nny360.com

text.text: NSDC reveals signs of Russian special services' large cyberattack on Ukraine's govt agencies before Independence Day (Interfax Ukraine, Aug 19) Ukraine/Russia - Ukraine's NSDC discovered activities of the Russian Gamaredon group, finding "signs of preparation for a large coordinated attack on government agencies and critical infrastructure, aimed at destabilizing the situation in Ukraine before the Independence Day and during preparations for the next local elections."- Sources : https://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/682196.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-NSDC reveals signs of Russian special services' large cyberattack on Ukraine's govt agencies before Independence Day

text.text: FBI, DHS expose North Korean government malware used in fake job posting campaign (Cyberscoop, Aug 19) US/North Korea - The FBI and DHS’ cybersecurity agency released a report (https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/analysis-reports/ar20-232a)  on malware (BLINDINGCAN) that North Korean government hackers (Hidden Cobra) have been using to target defense contractors in the military and energy sectors via fake job postings on LinkedIn.- Sources : https://www.cyberscoop.com/north-korean-government-malware-hacking-fake-job-fbi-dhs/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-FBI, DHS expose North Korean government malware used in fake job posting campaign - CyberScoop

text.text: Russia and China are Penetrating Balkans at West’s Expense (Balkan Insights, Aug 19) Western Balkans - It uses historical, cultural, and particularly religious ties with the Balkan region to spread narratives against integration into European structures, questioning the fundamental values and principles of the EU. A recent US report (https://www.state.gov/russias-pillars-of-disinformation-and-propaganda-report/)  on Russia’s Pillars of Disinformation and Propaganda, describes Russian efforts to penetrate and perforate the political and information environments of targeted countries, including countries from the region.- Sources : https://edition.cnn.com/2020/08/17/tech/huawei-us-sanctions-hnk-intl/index.html
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Open Menu

text.text: New sanctions deal 'lethal blow' to Huawei. China decries US bullying (CNN, Aug 18) China/US - The US cut off Huawei's access to vital, advanced computer chips, striking a deadly blow to the Chinese tech champion in fresh sanctions that restrict any foreign semiconductor company from selling chips developed or produced using US software or technology to Huawei, without first obtaining a license to do so.- Sources : https://balkaninsight.com/2020/08/18/russia-and-china-are-penetrating-balkans-at-wests-expense/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Hackers can now clone your keys just by listening to them with a smartphone (Mashable, Aug 18) Global - A new research paper (https://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~junhan/papers/SpiKey_HotMobile20_CamReady.pdf)  details how hackers can clone keys using only a smartphone microphone and a program they designed. If a thief was able to install malware on your smartphone, smartwatch, or smart doorbell to record the audio from afar, they wouldn't even need to be physically nearby for the attack.- Sources : https://mashable.com/article/spikey-house-keys-listening-smartphone/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Mashable+%28Mashable%29
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Hackers can now clone your keys just by listening to them with a smartphone

text.text: The key (ahem) to the attack, dubbed SpiKey, is the sound made by the lock pins as they move over a typical key's ridges. "When a victim inserts a key into the door lock, an attacker walking by records the sound with a smartphone microphone."- Sources :
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Huge Cyberattacks Attempt To Silence Black Rights Movement With DDoS Attacks (Forbes, June 03) USA - According to Cloudflare, DDoS attacks against advocacy groups have spiked since protests erupted over George Floyd's death. Organizations with the purpose to fight prejudice went from seeing almost no attacks to 1,120 attempts to knock them offline. Similarly, DDoS attacks on government, police and emergency services websites were up 1.8 times and 3.8 times on military websites, compared to April.- Sources : https://www.forbes.com/sites/thomasbrewster/2020/06/03/huge-cyber-attacks-attempt-to-silence-black-rights-movement-with-ddos-attacks/#6c98c1b5742b
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Huge Cyberattacks Attempt To Silence Black Rights Movement With DDoS Attacks

text.text: Number of cyber attacks on Ukraine's government agencies grows by 56% within week (Unian, June 03) Ukraine - Ukraine's system of government agencies' secure access to the Internet blocked 10,767 cyberattacks last week - a 56% increase from the previous week. Application level attacks in the network accounted for the lion's share (99%). Moreover, 25 DDoS attacks were blocked, mainly targeting the websites of the Office of the President of Ukraine. The cyber defense system of state information resources and critical infrastructure facilities also recorded 115,459 suspicious events (7% increase).- Sources : https://www.unian.info/society/syber-security-number-of-cyber-attacks-on-ukraine-s-government-agencies-grows-by-56-within-week-11022938.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-\xd0\xa1yber Security - Number of cyber attacks on Ukraine's government agencies grows by 56% within week \xe2\x80\x94 UNIAN

text.text: Hackers and hucksters reinvigorate 'Anonymous' brand amid protests (Reuters, June 03) Global - The internet activist movement, Anonymous, has experienced a resurgence amid protests against police brutality. Accounts using the Anonymous name took credit for taking a Minneapolis police website offline and, inaccurately, for hacking police passwords. Millions of Twitter accounts began following/retweeting longstanding Anonymous posters. McGill University professor, Gabriella Coleman, said that key figures from a decade ago are involved, assisted by mechanical amplification.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-protests-anonymous/hackers-and-hucksters-reinvigorate-anonymous-brand-amid-protests-idUSKBN23A06I
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY- Hackers and hucksters reinvigorate \'Anonymous\' brand amid protests - Reuters

text.text: Ransomware gangs team up to form extortion cartel (Bleeping Computer, June 03) Global - According to KeLa (https://ke-la.com/) , ransomware gangs are teaming up to extort victims through a shared data leak platform, and the exchange of tactics and intelligence. Last year, the Maze Ransomware operators transformed ransomware attacks into data breaches, by releasing data of uncooperative victims on a dedicated "Maze News" site - a tactic which was quickly adopted by 13 ransomware operations. Now, Maze is allegedly creating a cartel of ransomware operations to share resources and extort victims.- Sources : https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ransomware-gangs-team-up-to-form-extortion-cartel/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Ransomware gangs team up to form extortion cartel

text.text: - Sources :
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: In a CBC report (https://ca.news.yahoo.com/hospitals-overwhelmed-cyberattacks-fuelled-booming-090000963.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZGF0YWJyZWFjaGVzLm5ldC9jYW5hZGlhbi1ob3NwaXRhbHMtb3ZlcndoZWxtZWQtYnktY3liZXJhdHRhY2tzLWZ1ZWxsZWQtYnktYm9vbWluZy1ibGFjay1tYXJrZXQv&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAMP9Gb9ZvYFxdNK-3Dcla1skdXhRnqD4w_6WnB42QUOi5qsxKe8b0sShC9f-kJ0tk7vo2ZV1Fyu96K2M2b0SeFn2jKQboI7QJya4UXJaR0Ui56rpNfWB77bwUiMzx6Z3WsjSseyGd5Y-O-aF_BGxVS-nnA4Rj2nsHfbmZqk5ManZ) , Raheel Qureshi's, co-founder of iSecurity Consulting, which works with more than 150 healthcare organizations in Canada, said that the health-care sector is targeted more than any other industry in the country.- Sources :
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Data suggests unprecedented interest in hacking and cybercrime during pandemic (Cybernews, June 02) Global -  With global unemployment rates rising due to prolonged COVID lockdowns, millions are trying to make themselves more employable in the digital job market by signing up for online courses, others appear to be increasingly looking at cybercrime. During March, April, and May, searches related to hacking, scamming, and other forms of cybercrime skyrocketed, with breakout search terms like “hacking course” and “ethical hacking course” reaching all-time highs. Moreover, visits to popular hacker websites and forums increased by up to 66% in March.- Sources : https://cybernews.com/security/data-suggests-unprecedented-interest-in-cybercrime-during-pandemic/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: National Cardiovascular Partners (NCP) Notifies Patients of Data Breach (IT Security Guru, July 28) US - US healthcare service National Cardiovascular Partners (NCP) has fallen victim of an email hack that exposed 78,000 cardiovascular patients’ data. The data was archived in an Excel spreadsheet, which was accessed by malicious actors back in April. The information exposed included sensitive data such as names, email addresses and more. The attackers’ objective was to commit financial fraud against NCP.- Sources : https://www.itsecurityguru.org/2020/07/28/national-cardiovascular-partners-ncp-notifies-patients-of-data-breach/?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=national-cardiovascular-partners-ncp-notifies-patients-of-data-breach
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-National Cardiovascular Partners (NCP) Notifies Patients of Data Breach - IT Security Guru

text.text: WhatsApp confirms Catalan politician's phone was target of 2019 attack (The  Security Guru, July 28) US - WhatsApp has confirmed that the mobile phone of a leading pro-independence politician in Catalonia was targeted over its messaging app in a 2019 attack that has been condemned as a possible case of domestic espionage in Europe. Operators of spyware made by NSO Group targeted the WhatsApp account "in an attempt to gain unauthorised access to data and communications on the device.”- Sources : https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2020/jul/28/whatsapp-confirms-catalan-politicians-phone-was-target-of-2019-attack
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-WhatsApp confirms Catalan politician\'s phone was target of 2019 attack | WhatsApp | The Guardian

text.text: Kaspersky: North Korean hackers are behind the VHD ransomware (ZDNet, July 28) North Korea - Kaspersky said that the North Korean Lazarus Group is behind a new ransomware strain known as VHD, based off of tools and techniques used during examined intrusions. According to Kaspersky, the data indicates that the VHD ransomware is not a commercial off-the-shelf product; and the Lazarus group is the sole owner of the MATA framework, which is used to deploy VHD as a final payload.- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/kaspersky-north-korean-hackers-are-behind-the-vhd-ransomware/#ftag=RSSbaffb68
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Kaspersky: North Korean hackers are behind the VHD ransomware | ZDNet

text.text: Intel community returns final Russia report volume to Senate after declassification review (The Hill, July 27) US - The intelligence community recently returned the last volume of the Senate Intelligence Committee’s Russia interference report to the panel after conducting a declassification review, which means the highly-anticipated report could be publicly released in a matter of weeks, The Hill has learned.- Sources : https://thehill.com/policy/national-security/509222-intel-community-returns-final-russia-report-volume-to-senate-after
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Intel community returns final Russia report volume to Senate after declassification review | TheHill

text.text: PRESS RELEASE: Huawei launches Africa Cloud&AI Innovation Centre (CAJ News Africa, July 27) South Africa - HUAWEI announced the launch of a South Africa-based Cloud and AI Innovation Centre to drive innovation, knowledge transfer, and economic growth through app development in the AI industry. The announcement was made by HUAWEI at an online event on cloud computing under the theme “Building an Intelligent Africa.” Africa’s data-centre capacity has doubled in the past three years. However, it still accounts for less than one percent of global availability.- Sources : https://www.cajnewsafrica.com/2020/07/28/press-release-huawei-launches-africa-cloudai-innovation-centre/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-PRESS RELEASE: Huawei launches Africa Cloud&AI Innovation Centre – CAJ News Africa

text.text: Risk of China cyber attacks, DoT seeks security audit (India Express, July 21) India/China - Following reports of a spike in coordinated cyberattacks by Chinese hackers, the Indian Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has written to all web portals and websites within its ambit to conduct a security audit and submit a compliance certificate asap. Government officials said such attacks have increased multifold since the border clash with China on June 15 and the ban of 59 China-linked apps. Most of these attacks are in the nature of DDoS, phishing, data exfiltration, RAT, and keylogging.- Sources : https://indianexpress.com/article/technology/tech-news-technology/risk-of-china-cyber-attacks-dot-seeks-security-audit-6515587/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Risk of China cyber attacks, DoT seeks security audit | Technology News,The Indian Express

text.text: Patriotic astroturfing in the Azerbaijan-Armenia Twitter war (DFRLab, July 21) Armenia/Azerbaijan - Amid the most serious clashes at the Armenia-Azerbaijan border since the 2016 Four-Day-War, web brigades of pro-Azerbaijan accounts are astroturfing pro-Azerbaijan and anti-Armenian hashtags on Twitter. The ongoing military dispute has long had an information warfare component. While neither country has an official cyber army, hacktivist groups from both sides have launched cyber attacks on the other’s government and media websites.- Sources : https://medium.com/dfrlab/patriotic-astroturfing-in-the-azerbaijan-armenia-twitter-war-9d234206cdd7
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: Vulnerable Cellular Routers Targeted in Latest Attacks on Israel Water Facilities (Security Week, July 21) Israel/Iran - In late April that hackers had targeted ICS at (waste)water and facilities across Israel. The attacks were blocked but  the incidents could have had serious consequences as the hackers attempted to mix harmful chemicals into the water source. A threat actor believed to be working for the Iranian government recently launched another round of attacks on Israel’s water sector, using vulnerable cellular equipment as an entry point.- Sources : https://www.securityweek.com/vulnerable-cellular-routers-targeted-latest-attacks-israel-water-facilities?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Securityweek+%28SecurityWeek+RSS+Feed%29
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: Two Chinese Hackers Working with the Ministry of State Security Charged with Global Computer Intrusion Campaign Targeting Intellectual Property and Confidential Business Information, Including COVID-19 Research (US DoJ, July 21) US/China - A federal grand jury in Spokane, WA. returned an indictment charging two Chinese with hacking into systems of hundreds of companies, governments, NGOs, dissidents, clergy, and democratic / human rights activists in the US and abroad (e.g. Hong Kong). In some cases, the hackers acted for personal gain, and in others for the benefit of Chinese government agencies.- Sources : https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/two-chinese-hackers-working-ministry-state-security-charged-global-computer-intrusion
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Lock

text.text: UK Govt Criticized for 'Lack of Curiosity' About Russian 'Meddling' (The Moscow Times, July 21) UK/Russia - UK lawmakers slammed the government for failing to look into Russian meddling into UK politics, despite evidence of the country posing a credible threat. Parliament's Intelligence and Security Committee's report had been expected to shed light on whether the Kremlin interfered in the Brexit referendum. MPs said they were unable to come to firm conclusions as the government or its predecessor had not ordered an investigation due to a "lack of curiosity."- Sources : https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2020/07/21/uk-govt-criticized-for-lack-of-curiosity-about-russian-meddling-a70943
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-UK Govt Criticized for \'Lack of Curiosity\' About Russian \'Meddling\' - The Moscow Times

text.text: Kenya’s internet balloons could help to bridge the digital divide (The South African, July 19) Kenya - Kenya has, in partnership with Google’s sister firm, Loon, launched (https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/07/world/africa/google-loon-balloon-kenya.html)  a fleet of 35 internet balloons that will provide internet services to remote areas of the country. This is the first balloon-powered internet to launch in Africa. Google’s internet balloons are wireless Internet connectivity towers that float in the stratosphere. A single balloon can provide internet connectivity to around 1k users on the ground.- Sources : https://www.thesouthafrican.com/technology/kenya-internet-balloons-bridge-digital-divide/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Kenya's internet balloons could help to bridge the digital divide

text.text: Bangladesh Restores Internet to Rohingya Camps (Radio Free Asia, Aug 31) Bangladesh - Bangladesh restored internet access in Rohingya refugee camps and surrounding communities after a year-long blackout, saying pressure from international groups led to the change. The internet ban was allegedly imposed to ensure security for the Rohingya population. The blockage left Bangladeshis who live in communities that surround the camps without internet service as well.- Sources : https://www.rfa.org/english/news/myanmar/bangladesh-rohingya-08312020072225.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Bangladesh Restores Internet to Rohingya Camps

text.text: Anonymous group hack reveals hidden government data about COVID-19 cases in Nicaragua (Global Voices, Aug 31) Nicaragua - The decentralized cyber hacking group Anonymous attacked Nicaragua’s Health Ministry archives, leaking 400 files (https://100noticias.com.ni/nacionales/102532-anonymous-documentos-minsa-coronavirus/)  which reveal a surplus of 6,245 positive COVID-19 cases in Nicaragua that were previously unknown to the public. The announcement (https://twitter.com/LorianSynaro/status/1293959498944655362)  was made on Twitter by a self-identified Anonymous member, Lorian Syrano.- Sources : https://globalvoices.org/2020/08/31/anonymous-group-hack-reveals-hidden-government-data-about-covid-19-cases-in-nicaragua/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Anonymous group hack reveals hidden government data about COVID-19 cases in Nicaragua · Global Voices

text.text: Jakarta Cyber-attacks Touted as Political Plot (Info Security, Aug 28) Indonesia - The Indonesian government suggests that recent cyberattacks against its critics could be an attempt to turn public opinion against it. This month, the Southeast Asia Freedom of Expression Network (SafeNet) recorded (https://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2020/08/28/please-refrain-from-accusing-govt-over-recent-hacker-attacks-ministry.html)  six cyberattacks against journalists, academics, and activists, who had criticized the government’s handling of the COVID-19 health crisis.- Sources : https://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/news/jakarta-cyberattacks-touted-as/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Jakarta Cyber-attacks Touted as Political Plot - Infosecurity Magazine

text.text: Iranian hackers are selling access to compromised companies on an underground forum (ZDNet, Sep 01) Iran - A CrowdStrike report (https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/who-is-pioneer-kitten/) claims that Iran's state-sponsored hacking group, Pioneer/Fox Kitten, is selling access to compromised corporate networks on an underground hacking forum. The group has spent 2019 and 2020 hacking into corporate networks via vulnerabilities in VPNs and networkinghttps://www.zdnet.com/article/fbi-says-an-iranian-hacking-group-is-attacking-f5-networking-devices/equipment.- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/iranian-hackers-are-selling-access-to-compromised-companies-on-an-underground-forum/#ftag=RSSbaffb68
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Iranian hackers are selling access to compromised companies on an underground forum | ZDNet

text.text: Google-Facebook ditch plans to dock giant data cable in Hong Kong (BBC, Aug 31) US/Hong Kong - Plans for an underwater data cable between LA and Hong Kong have been dropped after the US government expressed fears that China could steal data from it. New plans (https://licensing.fcc.gov/myibfs/download.do?attachment_key=2687648) mention links with the Philippines and Taiwan only. The 12,800 km long cable has already been laid. However it needs permission from the US Federal Communications Commission in order to operate.- Sources : https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-53972238
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-email

text.text: The Coming Revolution in Intelligence Affairs (Foreign Affairs, Aug 31) Australian - In the future of intelligence affairs, machines will become more than just tools for information collection and analysis. They will become intelligence consumers, decision-makers, and even targets of other machine intelligence operations. Machine-driven intelligence will operate at such speed, scale, and complexity that human-driven intelligence will no longer be able to keep up.- Sources : https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/north-america/2020-08-31/coming-revolution-intelligence-affairs
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Foreign Affairs

text.text: Standardising the splinternet: how China’s technical standards could fragment the internet (Journal of Cyber Policy, Aug 29) China - Researchers argue that China’s drive for technological dominance, which has resulted in a long-term, government-driven national strategy, could pave the way to a new form of internet governance that is multilateral instead of multistakeholder. A fragmented network would introduce new challenges to cyber defence and could provide adversaries with a technical means to undermine the norms, predictability and security of today’s cyberspace – which would also impact human rights and widen the digital divide.- Sources : https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/23738871.2020.1805482?af=R
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Draconian law used to silence green websites (Deccan Herald, July 21) India - Websites of 3 environmental organizations - Let India Breathe, There is No Earth B, and Fridays for Future have been blocked on government orders. Gurshabad Grover from the The Centre for Internet and Society, Bengaluru, says such a block is rare. Let India Breathe reached out to the Internet Freedom Foundation for help.  Apar Gupta, executive director of the foundation, says the block is unprecedented.- Sources : https://www.deccanherald.com/metrolife/metrolife-your-bond-with-bengaluru/draconian-law-used-to-silence-green-websites-863981.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Draconian law used to silence green websites | Deccan Herald

text.text: Chinese Hackers Escalate Attacks Against India and Hong Kong Amid Tensions (Hacker News, July 21) India/HK/China - An emerging threat actor out of China has been traced to a new hacking campaign aimed at Indian government agencies and Hong Kong residents intending to steal sensitive information, Malwarebytes report (https://blog.malwarebytes.com/threat-analysis/2020/07/chinese-apt-group-targets-india-and-hong-kong-using-new-variant-of-mgbot-malware/)  reveals. The attacks were observed during the first week of July, coinciding the passage of controversial security law in Hong Kong and India's ban of 59 China-made apps over privacy concerns, weeks after violent skirmishes along the Indo-China border.- Sources : https://thehackernews.com/2020/07/chinese-hackers-hong-kong-india.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+TheHackersNews+%28The+Hackers+News+-+Cyber+Security+Blog%29
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Chinese Hackers Escalate Attacks Against India and Hong Kong Amid Tensions

text.text: Iran says foreign states may have carried out cyberattacks, plays down their role in fires (Yeni Safak, July 23) Iran - Iran said foreign governments may have been behind recent cyberattacks on Iranian facilities, but played down the possibility of their role in a series of fires and explosions at military and other installations. Since late June, several fires or explosions have been reported at military, industrial and nuclear sites in Iran as well as at oil refineries, power plants, factories and businesses.- Sources : https://www.yenisafak.com/en/news/iran-says-foreign-states-may-have-carried-out-cyberattacks-plays-down-their-role-in-fires-3535179
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Iran says foreign states may have carried out cyberattacks, plays down their role in fires

text.text: British security services to get extra powers in wake of Russia report (The Guardian, July 22) UK/Russia - Security services are set to be given extra powers to prevent foreign interference in British democracy following a damning report (https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jul/21/russia-report-reveals-uk-government-failed-to-address-kremlin-interference-scottish-referendum-brexit)  from MPs on the potential threat posed by Russia. It has been suggested the UK could introduce a “register of foreign agents." The move comes with Labour poised to go on the offensive on the issue today, parliament’s final sitting day before the summer recess.- Sources : https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2020/jul/22/british-security-services-to-get-extra-powers-in-wake-of-russia-report
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-British security services to get extra powers in wake of Russia report | UK security and counter-terrorism | The Guardian

text.text: Huawei, ZTE are tools of Chinese hegemony in Asia, says former US National Security Advisor John Bolton (Medianama, July 21) US/China - Taking control of 5G through Huawei and ZTE is a long-term Chinese strategy to assert its hegemony over Asia, former US National Security Advisor John Bolton said. To combat China’s global dominance, the rest of the world would have to “think strategically in response.” Earlier, The House voted (https://www.politico.com/news/2020/07/20/house-tiktok-federal-phones-374315) to bar federal employees from downloading TikTok on government-issued devices as part of a $741 billion defense policy bill.- Sources : https://www.medianama.com/2020/07/223-john-bolton-china-huawei/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Huawei, ZTE are tools of Chinese hegemony in Asia, says former US National Security Advisor John Bolton

text.text: OpenAI’s new language generator GPT-3 is shockingly good—and completely mindless (MIT Technology Review, July 22) Global - OpenAI began providing its GPT-3 software to selected people as part of a private beta. OpenAI plans to turn GPT-3 into a commercial product later this year. A blog post (https://arr.am/2020/07/09/gpt-3-an-ai-thats-eerily-good-at-writing-almost-anything/)  shows off short stories, songs, press releases, technical manuals, and more that the AI was used to generate. GPT-3 can also produce pastiches of particular writers.- Sources : https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/07/20/1005454/openai-machine-learning-language-generator-gpt-3-nlp/?truid=26ed320dce9b06b5f4e661f524e2c698&utm_source=the_download&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=the_download.unpaid.engagement&utm_term=non-subs&utm_content=07-22-2020
text.headline: FORESIGHT-OpenAI\xe2\x80\x99s new language generator GPT-3 is shockingly good\xe2\x80\x94and completely mindless | MIT Technology Review

text.text: New York Gears Up for Cyberattacks on November Elections (Wall Street Journal, July 22) US - NY state is training election officials on cybersecurity measures in the latest attempt to shore up voting systems before November. The state’s Board of Elections began a series of exercises to simulate disinformation campaigns, malware targeting voting machines, and the disruption of systems that store voter registration data.- Sources : https://www.wsj.com/articles/new-york-gears-up-for-cyberattacks-on-november-elections-11595410200
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Hackers are still running coronavirus-related campaigns, CrowdStrike warns (CyberScoop, June 24) Global - CrowdStrike's Vice President of Intelligence, Adam Meyers, says that nation-states and criminal spearphishing campaigns that leverage COVID-19 themed lures are still on the rise. CrowdStrike has seen "an increase of … social engineering where they’re impersonating things like the WHO, CDC, HHS, hospitals, healthcare[entities], and even insurance companies to entice people.- Sources : https://www.cyberscoop.com/coronavirus-hacking-disinformation-ransomware-spearphishing/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Hackers are still\xc2\xa0running coronavirus-related campaigns, CrowdStrike warns - CyberScoop

text.text: Saudi dissident warned by Canada that he is 'potential target' for Gulf kingdom (Middle East Eye, June 21) Saudi Arabia - Exiled Saudi activist, Omar Abdulaziz, has been warned by Canadian police about “credible information about a possible plan to harm him” by the Saudi government. Abdulaziz was among Saudi dissidents whose phones were hacked in 2018, shortly before Jamal Khashoggi was brutally murdered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul.- Sources : https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/canada-warns-dissident-saudi-arabia-omar-abdulaziz-target-him
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-None

text.text: CHI St. Luke's Health-Memorial reports patient information data breach (Lufkin Daily News, June 24) US - CHI St. Luke’s Health-Memorial reported that an unauthorized third party gained access to patient information on April 23. The security breach was made through two employee email accounts including patient information, e.g. names, diagnoses, dates of services, and facility account numbers. The hospital stated that it has taken steps to ensure its network remains secure, but did not say what those steps are.- Sources : https://lufkindailynews.com/news/community/article_0391306f-09a3-5d55-a089-9317f9c4b3af.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-CHI St. Luke\'s Health-Memorial reports patient information data breach | Community | lufkindailynews.com

text.text: Cyber-enabled disinformation campaign targeted U.S.-Poland alliance (DFRLab, June 24) Poland/US - In April, hackers placed a fabricated letter on the Polish War Studies Academy website. The letter spoofed a Polish General and condemned the US "occupation of Poland.” Subsequently, emails were sent to various institutions asking for their comment. The operation is believed to be aimed at igniting anti-US sentiments in Poland - a goal in line with Russia’s disinformation activities in the country.- Sources : https://medium.com/dfrlab/cyber-based-disinformation-operation-targets-u-s-poland-alliance-a7033a83700a
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: Israel honours military units behind Iran cyberattack (Middle East Eye, June 25) Israel/Iran - Israel has given “certificates of appreciation” to the units that participated in the “successful covert operation” that targeted an Iranian port in May. Those awarded include the infamous Unit 8200, whose work caused massive backups on waterways and roads leading to the facility. The attack was presumably in retaliation for an earlier attempted cyberattack on rural water distribution systems in Israel.- Sources : https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/israel-iran-cyberattack-shahid-rajaee-port
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: Israel Nearly Doubled Exports of Surveillance Systems to Track Civilians, Refugees (Haaretz, June 22) Israel - Israel increased its exports of civilian and refugee monitoring technology. Israel’s export of intelligence/cyber systems and communications monitoring systems, constituted 14% of total Israeli exports in 2019, compared to 8% in 2018. The number of deals Israel sealed with foreign countries rose, but their worth decreased. Contracts worth $7.2 billion were signed in 2019, compared to $7.5 billion in 2018 and $9.2 billion in 2017.- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/twitter-bans-ddosecrets-account-over-blueleaks-police-data-dump/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Twitter bans DDoSecrets account over \'BlueLeaks\' police data dump | ZDNet

text.text: Twitter bans DDoSecrets account over 'BlueLeaks' police data dump (ZDNet, June 23) US - Twitter has banned the @DDoSecrets account for violating its policy about the distribution of hacked data. DDoSecrets published 296 GB of data from over 200 police entities, dubbed BlueLeaks, they allegedly received from Anonymous. The hack is considered the biggest hack in the history of US law enforcement, revealing over 10 years of sensitive files about police training and operations.- Sources : https://www.computing.co.uk/news/4016952/us-justice-department-accuses-assange-collaborating-anonymous-lulzsec-hackers-indictment
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: US Justice Department accuses Assange of collaborating with 'Anonymous' and LulzSec hackers in new indictment (Computing, June 25) US - A new US indictment accuses WikiLeaks founder Assange of collaborating with hackers linked to "LulzSec" and "Anonymous" in efforts to obtain classified government information. As per indictment, Assange provided LulzSec's with a list of target organisations to hack. The hacker who received the list - an FBI informer at the time, was allegedly told that the most significant release of data would be from the NSA, CIA, or the NYT.- Sources :
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Krebs Calls COVID-19 ‘Biggest Driver’ of Cyber Modernization (Reuter, June 24) Global - Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) Director Christopher Krebs called the COVID-19 pandemic – and the quick switch to telework stemming from efforts to curtail the spread of the virus – one of the “biggest drivers” of IT and cyber modernization in recent times.- Sources : https://www.meritalk.com/articles/krebs-calls-covid-19-biggest-driver-of-cyber-modernization/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Krebs Calls COVID-19 \xe2\x80\x98Biggest Driver\xe2\x80\x99 of Cyber Modernization – MeriTalk

text.text: Ransomware operators now threatening to publish stolen data in extortion demands (CyberScoop, June 24) Global - Ransomware attackers typically encrypt files with the promise of decryption if victims make good on hefty ransom demands. But the status quo among ransomware operators has been shaken in the last several months, and they’re now beginning to move away from just demanding ransoms from victims. They’re also running hack-and-leak operations, according to CrowdStrike.- Sources : https://www.cyberscoop.com/ransomware-hack-leak-extortion-crowdstrike-falcon/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Ransomware operators now threatening to publish stolen details in extortion threats

text.text: NSO Group spyware used against Moroccan journalist days after company pledged to respect human rights (Amnesty International, June 22) Morocco - NSO Group, the Israeli company marketing its technology in the fight against COVID-19, contributed to a sustained campaign by the government of Morocco to spy on Moroccan journalist Omar Radi, a new investigation (https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/research/2020/06/moroccan-journalist-targeted-with-network-injection-attacks-using-nso-groups-tools/)  by Amnesty International reveals.- Sources : https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2020/06/nso-spyware-used-against-moroccan-journalist/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-NSO Group spyware used against Moroccan journalist days after company pledged to respect human rights | Amnesty International

text.text: Hacker allegedly breaches Indonesian govt database on Covid-19 test-takers (Asia One, June 22) Indonesia - Hackers breached an Indonesian government database of 230,000 people who have undergone Covid-19 testing. Under the username Database Shopping, the hackers offered the personal data of the test-takers on Raid Forums, showing an example of the breached data sets, which included names, addresses, ages, and nationalities.- Sources : https://www.asiaone.com/asia/hacker-allegedly-breaches-indonesian-govt-database-covid-19-test-takers
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Hacker allegedly breaches Indonesian govt database on Covid-19 test-takers, Asia News - AsiaOne

text.text: India Faces Cyberattack Threat By China-backed Hackers: Report (Mashable India, June 22) India/China - Cyfirma, a cyber intelligence firm, recently revealed that China-backed hackers are targeting several government agencies and businesses in India as per the conversations found by the firm on the dark web. Hackers had reportedly published a list on Chinese hacker forums which included names of reputed Indian companies, banks, and media houses including Airtel, BSNL, Hindustan Times, Times Of India, and more.- Sources : https://in.mashable.com/tech/14975/india-faces-cyberattack-threat-by-china-backed-hackers-report
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-India Faces Cyberattack Threat By China-backed Hackers: Report - tech

text.text: Indian Railways Hit By Malware Attack From Pakistan, China; Train Movement Data Stolen (Trak.in, June 22) India/Pakistan According to reports (https://www.livemint.com/news/india/indian-railways-alerted-on-malware-attack-sources-11592621909061.html)  of the Indian Railway Board Chairman, the national transporter keeps on getting malware security threats. These news comes a day after Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation Limited (DFCCIL) decided to terminate a 417-km signalling project with a Chinese firm. India's intelligence agency said that the system of the Railways has also been hit by Pakistan-linked APT 36.- Sources : https://trak.in/tags/business/2020/06/22/indian-railways-hit-by-malware-attack-from-pakistan-china-train-movement-data-stolen/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: ‘BlueLeaks’ Exposes Files from Hundreds of Police Departments (Krebs on Security, June 22) US - Hundreds of thousands of potentially sensitive files from US police departments were leaked under and made searchable online. The collection, dubbed “BlueLeaks”, stems from a security breach at a Texas web design and hosting company that maintains a number of state law enforcement data-sharing portals. The collection (270 GB), is the latest release from Distributed Denial of Secrets (DDoSecrets), an alternative to WikiLeaks that publishes caches of previously secret data.- Sources : https://krebsonsecurity.com/2020/06/blueleaks-exposes-files-from-hundreds-of-police-departments/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-‘BlueLeaks’ Exposes Files from Hundreds of Police Departments —  Krebs on Security

text.text: People in Myanmar Don’t Know About Coronavirus Because the Government Blocked the Internet (VICE, June 22) Myanmar - The world’s longest-running internet shutdown has left over a million in Myanmar in the dark for a year, and many  in the affected region don’t even know about the coronavirus pandemic. The internet shutdown, along with restrictions on aid agencies’ ability to visit villages in the affected regions, has meant that people in some villages in Rakhine and Chin state are unaware of the COVID-19 outbreak (https://www.hrw.org/news/2020/06/19/myanmar-end-worlds-longest-internet-shutdown) , humanitarian workers told Human Rights Watch.- Sources : https://www.vice.com/en_in/article/z3emza/a-million-people-in-myanmar-dont-know-about-coronavirus-because-the-government-blocked-the-internet
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-VICE

text.text: Exclusive: Massive spying on users of Google's Chrome shows new security weakness (Reuter, June 19) Global - A newly discovered spyware effort attacked users through 32 million downloads of extensions to Google’s market-leading Chrome web browser, researchers at Awake Security told Reuters, highlighting the tech industry’s failure to protect browsers as they are used more for email, payroll and other sensitive functions.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-alphabet-google-chrome-exclusive-idUSKBN23P0JO
text.headline: FORESIGHT- Exclusive: Massive spying on users of Google\'s Chrome shows new security weakness - Reuters

text.text: Hackers delete social media content of independent Azerbaijani news outlet Meydan TV (Committee to Protect Journalists, July 14) Azerbaijan - In mid-June, hackers deleted content from the Azeri-language Facebook page of Meydan TV - an independent news outlet that covers Azerbaijan. The outlet believes that the attack may have been committed by hackers supportive of Azerbaijan’s government. Meydan TV is known for its critical reporting, covering state corruption, press freedom, and human rights violations.- Sources : https://cpj.org/2020/07/hackers-delete-social-media-content-of-independent-azerbaijani-news-outlet-meydan-tv/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Hackers delete social media content of independent Azerbaijani news outlet Meydan TV - Committee to Protect Journalists

text.text: US, UK, Interpol give Ghana phone hacking tools, raising journalist concerns on safety and confidentiality (Committee to Protect Journalists, July 14) Ghana - In May, Ghana police’s criminal investigation department spoke about how the US, UK, and Interpol provided Ghana with digital investigations training and technology. Journalists in Ghana worry about how such technology may be used against them or their sources.- Sources : https://cpj.org/2020/07/us-uk-interpol-give-ghana-phone-hacking-tools-raising-journalist-concerns-on-safety-and-confidentiality/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-US, UK, Interpol give Ghana phone hacking tools, raising journalist concerns on safety and confidentiality - Committee to Protect Journalists

text.text: Cybersecurity firm finds more spyware hidden in Chinese tax software (NBC News, July 14) China - Last month, Trustwave uncovered spyware hidden in Chinese tax software that Chinese bank clients are required to install as a condition of doing business in China. A new report (https://www.trustwave.com/en-us/resources/blogs/spiderlabs-blog/goldenspy-chapter-4-goldenhelper-malware-embedded-in-official-golden-tax-software/)  highlights a further malware, GoldenHelper, that secretly installed a backdoor, gaving attackers complete access to the company’s networks.- Sources : https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/national-security/cybersecurity-firm-finds-more-spyware-hidden-chinese-tax-software-n1233662
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Cybersecurity firm finds more spyware hidden in Chinese tax software

text.text: South East Coast Ambulance sees massive data breach (Kent Online, July 15) UK - The South East Coast Ambulance Service has experienced a massive data breach and has referred itself to a privacy watchdog. In May, the personal and medical details of all ambulance staff could have been seen by employees outside of senior management.- Sources : https://www.kentonline.co.uk/ashford/news/data-breach-at-ambulance-service-230388/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-South East Coast Ambulance sees massive data breach

text.text: Exclusive, Ghost Squad Hackers defaced European Space Agency site (Security Affairs, July 15) Europe - The hacktivist collective, Ghost Squad Hackers, claims responsibility for the defacement of a European Space Agency website. The hackers claimed that the site defaced just for fun. The group claims to have hacked numerous organizations and government agencies over the years, including US military, EU, Washington DC, Israeli Defense Forces, the Indian Government, and some central banks.- Sources : https://securitybrief.eu/story/eset-uncovers-chat-app-malware-spying-and-stealing-user-s-data
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-ESET uncovers chat app malware spying and stealing user's data

text.text: - Sources : https://securityaffairs.co/wordpress/105918/hacktivism/european-space-agency-esa-site-defacement.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Ghost Squad Hackers defaced European Space Agency (ESA) siteSecurity Affairs

text.text: ESET uncovers chat app malware spying and stealing user's data (Security Brief, July 14) Middle East - ESET researchers discovered (https://www.welivesecurity.com/2020/07/14/welcome-chat-secure-messaging-app-nothing-further-truth/) a new operation that masquerades as the Android chat app - Welcome Chat, to spy on users and leak stolen data. The operation is believed to be part of a long-running cyber-espionage campaign in the Middle East by a threat actor known as Gaza Hackers, or Molerats. Welcome Chat serves as spyware while also delivering the promised chatting functionality.- Sources :
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: Exclusive: Secret Trump order gives CIA more powers to launch cyberattacks (Yahoo News, July 15) US - The CIA has used its increased freedom to conduct covert actions against Iran and other countries. The CIA's ability to conduct cyberattacks got a boost in 2018, after Trump signed a secret order giving it more freedom. It was designed to let the US go on the offensive against "adversarial countries" like Russia, China, Iran, North Korea and others.- Sources : https://news.yahoo.com/secret-trump-order-gives-cia-more-powers-to-launch-cyberattacks-090015219.html?soc_src=hl-viewer&soc_trk=tw
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Secret Trump order gives CIA more powers to launch cyberattacks

text.text: UK should face ‘public and painful’ retaliation over Huawei decision, Chinese state media urges (CNBC, July 15) UK/China - The UK should face retaliation over its decision to ban Huawei from its 5G networks, Chinese state-backed media urged, dubbing the move “ill-founded.” On Tuesday, the UK said the country’s mobile network operators will not be allowed to buy new Huawei 5G gear after Dec. 31 and carriers must also strip out existing Huawei 5G gear by the end of 2027.- Sources : https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/15/huawei-uk-ban-china-state-media-urges-retaliation-against-britain.html
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Huawei UK ban: China state media urges retaliation against Britain

text.text: Companies Worry EU Court Ruling Could Disrupt Global Data Transfers (Wall Street Journal, July 15) EU - The European Union’s highest court will decide Thursday whether a widely used tool for moving data from within the bloc to outside countries is legal. Companies have started looking for alternative methods to continue transferring personal information around the world ahead of the ruling.- Sources : https://www.wsj.com/articles/companies-worry-eu-court-ruling-could-disrupt-global-data-transfers-11594805401?mod=djemCybersecruityPro&tpl=cy
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: A new way to train AI systems could keep them safer from hackers (MIT Technology Review, July 10) Global - A perceived flaw of deep learning is its vulnerability to adversarial attacks. Most adversarial research focuses on image recognition systems, but deep-learning-based image reconstruction systems are vulnerable too - particularly troubling in health care (cf. reconstruction of medical images). Researchers at the University of Illinois are proposing a new method for training such deep-learning systems to be more failproof and thus trustworthy in safety-critical scenarios.- Sources : https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/07/10/1005048/ai-deep-learning-safe-from-hackers-adversarial-attacks/?truid=26ed320dce9b06b5f4e661f524e2c698&utm_source=the_download&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=the_download.unpaid.engagement&utm_term=non-subs&utm_content=07-15-2020
text.headline: FORESIGHT-A new way to train AI systems could keep them safer from hackers | MIT Technology Review

The non-medical company was featured in the New York Times (https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/20/technology/new-york-ventilators-coronavirus.html)  as it developed and mass produced FDA-approved ventilators in a month.- Sources : https://www.itwire.com/security/ny-ventilator-innovator-hit-by-windows-doppelpaymer-ransomware.html

text.text: The US is building a new Great Firewall (Quartz, Aug 06) US/China -  The US state department is expanding its “Clean Network” initiative (https://www.state.gov/announcing-the-expansion-of-the-clean-network-to-safeguard-americas-assets/#.XyskRCepNOE.twitter)  to root out major Chinese tech products, aimed to guard citizens’ privacy and companies’ sensitive information from “aggressive intrusions by malign actors." The policy is reminiscent of those of authoritarian regimes, which often advocate “internet sovereignty” (i.e. the idea that a nation’s sovereignty extends into cyberspace).- Sources : https://qz.com/1889077/us-clean-network-campaign-shuts-out-chinese-apps-from-network/
