text.text: Data leaks surge almost 500% at 27 billion amid pandemic (Atlas VPN, Aug 24) Global - Data breaches exposing millions of personal records are becoming the new normal. Data leaks reached an all-time high, rising by 492% to a record 27 billion in the first half of 2020. The amount of records exposed in the first half of 2020 is 12 billion more than the total number during the entirety of 2019 and four times higher than any six month time period between 2013 and 2020.- Sources : https://atlasvpn.com/blog/data-leaks-surge-almost-500-at-27-billion-amid-pandemic
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-None

text.text: Iranian hackers attack exposed RDP servers to deploy Dharma ransomware (BleepingComputer, Aug 24) Iran - Low-skilled hackers from Iran are targeting (https://www.group-ib.com/media/iran-cybercriminals/) companies in Russia, India, China, and Japan, going after easy hits with publicly available tools. What makes this case surprising is that "Iran has traditionally been a land of state-sponsored attackers engaged in espionage and sabotage.”- Sources : https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/iranian-hackers-attack-exposed-rdp-servers-to-deploy-dharma-ransomware/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Iranian hackers attack exposed RDP servers to deploy Dharma ransomware

text.text: Hackers Leak Alleged Internal Files of Chinese Social Media Monitoring Firms (Vice Motherboard, Aug 21) China - Hackers, going by the name CCP Unmasked (https://twitter.com/CCP_Unmasked) , reached out to journalists, pitching "a large dump of files" that they said exposes social media monitoring and disinformation campaigns conducted by three private companies at the behest of the Chinese government. After leaking some of the documents, the group was banned by Twitter under its hacked files policy.- Sources : https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/dyzewz/hackers-leak-alleged-internal-files-of-chinese-social-media-monitoring-firms
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-VICE

text.text: Facebook blocks group critical of Thai monarchy amid government pressure (Reuters, Aug 24) Thailand - Facebook blocked access within Thailand to a group with 1 million members that has criticised the country’s king, but said it was planning a legal challenge to the government’s demand that it block the group. The “Royalist Marketplace” group was created by Pavin Chachavalpongpun, a self-exiled academic and critic of the monarchy. Pavin said Facebook had bowed to the military-dominated government’s pressure.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-thailand-facebook/facebook-blocks-group-of-one-million-critical-of-thai-monarchy-amid-government-pressure-idUSKBN25K25C
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- Facebook blocks group critical of Thai monarchy amid government pressure - Reuters

text.text: TikTok Sues U.S. Government Over Trump Ban (NYT, Aug 24) US/China - TikTok sued the US government, accusing the Trump administration of depriving it of due process when Trump issued an executive order to block the app from operating in the US. The suit escalates an increasingly bitter back-and-forth between ByteDance and US officials. Trump has repeatedly claimed that TikTok poses a national security threat due to its alleged Chinese ties.- Sources : https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/24/technology/tiktok-sues-us-government-over-trump-ban.html  (https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/24/technology/tiktok-sues-us-government-over-trump-ban.html)
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-TikTok Sues U.S. Government Over Trump Ban - The New York Times

text.text: Russia ready to co-operate with Huawei on 5G: Ifax cites Lavrov (Reuters, Aug 23) Russia/China - Russia is ready to co-operate with China and its Huawei Technologies on 5G technology which Moscow is currently trying to develop, the Interfax news agency reported, citing Russia’s Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-huawei-5g-russia/russia-ready-to-co-operate-with-huawei-on-5g-ifax-cites-lavrov-idUSKBN25J0FE?utm_campaign=wp_the_cybersecurity_202&utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter&wpisrc=nl_cybersecurity202
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- Russia ready to co-operate with Huawei on 5G: Ifax cites Lavrov - Reuters

text.text: Hackers Are Posing as HR & Sending Lay-Off Mails to Push Malware (The Quint, Aug 22) Global - Cybercriminals disguised as the HR staff are sending lay-off emails to employees, pushing malware, accessing data, and entering networks of their organisations once the attachments are opened. The weakening of the economy during the pandemic in a number of countries has caused a wave of unemployment, and fraudsters did not miss this opportunity to strike via innovative phishing attacks.- Sources : https://www.thequint.com/tech-and-auto/tech-news/hackers-disguised-as-the-hr-sending-lay-off-emails-to-infect-with-malware
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: AT&T Tracks 2,000% Spike in COVID-19 Cyber Threats (SDX Central, July 02) Global - AT&T Cybersecurity and AT&T Alien Labs, Singtel Trustwave, and Telefónica ElevenPaths reported (https://cybersecurity.att.com/blogs/security-essentials/new-report-covid-19-threat-intelligence-insight-from-the-telco-security-alliance) a 2,000% spike in COVID-19 related threats in March compared to February. The report investigated threat actors including organized crime and nation states taking advantage of the pandemic to launch campaigns globally.- Sources : https://www.sdxcentral.com/articles/news/att-tracks-2000-spike-in-covid-19-cyber-threats/2020/07/

text.text: In six months, hackers attacked Russian government systems more than a billion times (E Hacking News, July 03) Russia - Since the beginning of 2020, the Russian Foreign Ministry recorded more than 1 billion malicious attacks on Russian critical information systems. Coordinated attacks have become more frequent, targeting government entities, the financial sector, healthcare, the defense industry, and research.- Sources : https://www.ehackingnews.com/2020/07/in-six-months-hackers-attacked-russian.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-In six months, hackers attacked Russian government systems more than a billion times - E Hacking News - Latest Hacker News and IT Security News

text.text: Hacker ransoms 23k MongoDB databases and threatens to contact GDPR authorities (ZDNet, July 01) Global -  Hackers have uploaded ransom notes on MongoDB databases without a password, accounting for 47% of all MongoDB databases accessible online. The hackers used an automated script to scan for misconfigured MongoDB databases, wiping their content, and leaving a ransom note behind threatening to leak their data and contact the victim's local GDPR enforcement authority.- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/hacker-ransoms-23k-mongodb-databases-and-threatens-to-contact-gdpr-authorities/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Hacker ransoms 23k MongoDB databases and threatens to contact GDPR authorities | ZDNet

text.text: Report: Israeli cyberattack caused Iran nuclear site fire, F35s hit missile base (Times of Israel, July 03) Israel/Iran - Kuwaiti newspaper claims that Israel was responsible for two blasts at Iranian facilities — one related to uranium enrichment, the other for missile production. The paper cited an unnamed senior source saying that an Israeli cyberattack caused a fire and explosion at the Natanz nuclear enrichment facility on Thursday morning.- Sources : https://www.timesofisrael.com/report-israeli-cyberattack-caused-iran-nuclear-site-fire-f35s-hit-missile-base/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Report: Israeli cyberattack caused Iran nuclear site fire, F35s hit missile base | The Times of Israel

text.text: Researchers link APT15 hackers to Chinese military company (Bleeping Computer, July 02) China - Lookout Threat Intel researchers have linked the APT15 hacking group known for Android spyware apps to a Chinese military company, Xi'an Tian He Defense Technology. Lookout showed how four Android "surveillanceware" tools used to target the Uyghur ethnic minority group are part of a more extensive mobile advanced persistent campaign that has been operating for years.- Sources : https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/researchers-link-apt15-hackers-to-chinese-military-company/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Researchers link APT15 hackers to Chinese military company

text.text: TrickBot malware now checks screen resolution to evade analysis (Bleeping Computer, July 01) Global - The TrickBot trojan has started to check the screen resolutions of victims to detect whether the malware is running in a virtual machine. Researchers typically analyze malware in a virtual machine that is configured with various analysis tools.- Sources : https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/trickbot-malware-now-checks-screen-resolution-to-evade-analysis/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-TrickBot malware now checks screen resolution to evade analysis

text.text: Morocco Asks Amnesty for Proof It Used Spyware on Journalist (Security Week, July 02) Morocco - Morocco's prime minister has demanded Amnesty International provide evidence to support its allegations that Rabat used NSO Pegasus spyware to spy on a journalist's phone. If the international watchdog fails to provide evidence, the kingdom "will take the necessary steps to defend its national security" and "clear up public opinion" on the allegations, Prime Minister Saad-Eddine El Othmani said.- Sources : https://www.securityweek.com/morocco-asks-amnesty-proof-it-used-spyware-journalist
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: (OPINION) Protecting undersea cables must be made a national security priority (Defense News, July 02) US - In recent years, US efforts have focused on preventing Huawei, the party-controlled Chinese telecoms giant, from gaining ground as the world’s largest supplier of 5G infrastructure. But defending a less understood part of digital infrastructure — undersea fiber-optic cables — should be an equal priority. There are currently approximately 750,000 miles of cables that crisscross the world’s oceans.- Sources : https://www.defensenews.com/opinion/commentary/2020/07/01/protecting-undersea-cables-must-be-made-a-national-security-priority/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Protecting undersea cables must be made a national security priority

text.text: Drones Aren't Just Hackers' Targets - They're Hackers' Weapons (Forbes, July 01) Global - A recent report from RAND (https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/research_reports/RR2900/RR2972/RAND_RR2972.pdf)  explores how hackers can exploit drones. The report confirms successful attacks of higher and lower sophistication and also notes that successful hacks are appearing on YouTube and various blogs. Even more concerning, the code used to accomplish drone hacks is often ending up on sites such as GitHub.- Sources : https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/drones-aren-t-just-hackers-targets-they-84261/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Drones Aren\'t Just Hackers\' Targets - They\'re Hackers\' Weapons | Locke Lord LLP - JDSupra

text.text: Ransomware attack leaves 5 years of patient records inaccessible at Colo. hospital (Healthcare IT News, June 16) US - Rangely District Hospital in Colorado issued a notice that a ransomware attack had targeted the software necessary to access five years of patient records. In addition, RDH can no longer access some records of patients who received home health services. Although the hospital was able to recover some of the files, "some electronic records [remain] unavailable or have not been recovered."- Sources : https://www.healthcareitnews.com/news/ransomware-attack-leaves-5-years-patient-records-inaccessible-co-hospital
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Ransomware attack leaves 5 years of patient records inaccessible at Colo. hospital | Healthcare IT News

text.text: Coronavirus-Themed Cyberattacks Drop, Microsoft (ThreatPost, June 17) Global - A Microsoft report (https://www.microsoft.com/security/blog/2020/06/16/exploiting-a-crisis-how-cybercriminals-behaved-during-the-outbreak/)  found that Covid-19-themed cyberattacks are now trending significantly down. The report also noted that those attacks have been a drop in the bucket compared to overall threats observed over the last four months. Attackers commonly used local lures in phishing campaigns aimed at spreading malware, committing identity theft, or creating other disruptions.- Sources : https://threatpost.com/coronavirus-themed-cyberattacks-drop-microsoft/156635/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Coronavirus-Themed Cyberattacks Drop — Microsoft | Threatpost

text.text: LinkedIn 'Job Offers' Targeted Aerospace, Military Firms With Malware (ThreatPost, June 17) EMEA/North Korea - A recent malware campaign targeted victims at European and Middle East aerospace and military companies – via LinkedIn spear-phishing messages, impersonating human resource employees from Collins Aerospace and General Dynamics. Targets were sent fake job offers that included malicious documents designed to fetch data-exfiltrating malware in an apparent espionage campaign.- Sources : https://threatpost.com/linkedin-job-offers-targeted-aerospace-military-firms-with-malware/156614/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-LinkedIn 'Job Offers' Targeted Aerospace, Military Firms With Malware | Threatpost

text.text: Indo-China border clash leads to heightened fears around cyber security (India Times, June 17) India/China - The Indian government and corporates are gearing up to boost their cyber security, expecting booby traps, phishing, honey traps, leaked document cases to go up on the back of the Indo-China border clashes. Cyber experts estimate that government surveillance to shoot up to prevent any information hacks as well.- Sources : https://telecom.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/indo-china-border-clash-leads-to-heightened-fears-around-cyber-security/76421905
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: Super secretive Russian disinfo operation discovered dating back to 2014 (ZDNet, June 16) Russia - Graphika published a 120-page report (https://secondaryinfektion.org/downloads/secondary-infektion-report.pdf)  on a new Russian information operation, codenamed Secondary Infektion. The group is different from the Internet Research Agency (i.e. Sankt Petersburg troll farm) that interfered in the US 2016 presidential election. Graphika says this new group has been operating since 2014 and has been relying on fake news articles, fake leaks, and forged documents to generate political scandals in countries across Europe and North America.- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/super-secretive-russian-disinfo-operation-discovered-dating-back-to-2014/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Super secretive Russian disinfo operation discovered dating back to 2014 | ZDNet

text.text: House panel to hold election-security hearing with Facebook, Google, Twitter (Reuters, June 16) US - Top officials from Facebook Inc, Alphabet Inc’s Google and Twitter Inc will appear before U.S. lawmakers on Thursday at a hearing on foreign influence and election security. The remote hearing will discuss the technology industry’s actions since the 2016 U.S. elections, state-sponsored disinformation efforts, and other related issues as the country moves toward the Nov. 3 presidential contest.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-security/house-panel-to-hold-election-security-hearing-with-facebook-google-twitter-idUSKBN23N2WA?feedType=RSS&feedName=technologyNews
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- House panel to hold election-security hearing with Facebook, Google, Twitter - Reuters

text.text: Lawmaker Questions Intelligence Community Cybersecurity (Homeland Security, June 17) US - Following damning CIA report on stolen hacking tools — “the largest data loss in CIA history” — Sen. Ron Wyden asked the Director of National Intelligence John Ratcliffe to explain what steps have been taken to improve the cybersecurity of some of the nation’s most sensitive secrets, held by federal intelligence agencies.- Sources :
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Hong Kong could come up against China’s Great firewall under the new national security law (The Print, June 15) Hong Kong - Hong Kong is bracing for the prospect of stricter digital controls — ones that would curtail free speech, communications, and the ability to organize and turn the city into a surveillance state resembling that of China. Residents and activists worry that proposed national security legislation will further encroach on civil liberties, as part of an effort by Beijing to exert its influence.- Sources : https://theprint.in/world/hong-kong-could-come-up-against-chinas-great-firewall-under-the-new-national-security-law/443062/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Hong Kong could come up against China's Great firewall under the new national security law

text.text: REvil/Sodinokibi Ransomware Specifically Targeting Food and Beverages Organizations (eHackingNews, Aug 20) Global - REvil (aka Sodinokibi) ransomware operators are targeting food and beverage organizations. The ransomware allegedly tries not to attack systems belonging to Iran, Russia other CIS states. In 2020, REvil attackers have limited their infection to North American and Western European organizations, targeting National Eating Disorders Association and Agromart Group.- Sources : https://www.ehackingnews.com/2020/08/revilsodinokibi-ransomware-specifically.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-REvil/Sodinokibi Ransomware Specifically Targeting Food and Beverages Organizations - E Hacking News - Latest Hacker News and IT Security News

text.text: Fake news on Covid-19 government initatives boost phishing in Brazil (ZDNet, Aug 19) Brazil - The massive increase of disinformation on government COVID-19 initiatives placed Brazil among the most affected by phishing, according to Kaspersky. 12.9% of Brazilian Internet users accessed (April to June 2020), a link that led to malicious websites. Global average is 8,26%. Brazil is the fifth most affected country after Venezuela (17.6%), Portugal (13.5%), Tunisia (13.5%), and France (13.1%).- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/fake-news-on-covid-19-government-initatives-boost-phishing-in-brazil/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Fake news on Covid-19 government initatives boost phishing in Brazil | ZDNet

text.text: List of 2020 election meddlers includes Cuba, Saudi Arabia and North Korea, US intelligence official says (CyberScoop, Aug 20) US - Cuba, Saudi Arabia, and North Korea are working to influence US elections by running information operations, according to the top counterintelligence official in the Trump administration, seeking to sow discord as Election Day looms, according to US Intelligence. The nature and duration of the operations was not specified.- Sources : https://www.cyberscoop.com/2020-election-interference-cuba-saudia-arabia-north-korea/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-List of 2020 election meddlers includes Cuba, Saudi Arabia and North Korea, US intelligence official says - CyberScoop

text.text: EU Regulators Wrangle Over Twitter Data Privacy Penalty (Security Week, Aug 20) EU - EU privacy regulators are wrangling over the penalty Ireland’s data privacy watchdog was set to issue Twitter for a data breach, pushing back the case’s long awaited conclusion under the bloc’s tough new data privacy rules. The case would be its first involving a US company since GDPR took effect in 2018, allowing for hefty fines.- Sources : https://www.securityweek.com/eu-regulators-wrangle-over-twitter-data-privacy-penalty?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Securityweek+%28SecurityWeek+RSS+Feed%29
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Facebook restricts more than 10,000 QAnon and US militia groups (The Guardian, Aug 19) Global - Facebook took down or restricted more than 10,000 groups, pages and Instagram accounts associated with QAnon, in an effort to combat the growth of the rightwing conspiracy theory. The moves are the result of a shift in the company’s policy toward movements that have “demonstrated significant risks to public safety” but do not meet the criteria for an outright ban (e.g. terrorist & hate groups).- Sources : https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/aug/19/facebook-qanon-us-militia-groups-restrictions
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Facebook restricts more than 10,000 QAnon and US militia groups | US news | The Guardian

text.text: A world divided into “cans” and “cannots” (MIT Technology Review, Aug 19) Global - Technology was said to make the world flatter, smaller, more open, and more equal. This now seems increasingly false, or at least simplistic. Countries are vying for dominance in technologies that could give them a strategic advantage: communications, energy, AI, surveillance, agricultural tech, cybersecurity, military tech … and now, amidst a global pandemic, medicine and manufacturing. The urge for nations to amass technological prowess and use it as an instrument of geopolitical power is what is meant by technonationalism.- Sources : https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/08/19/1006353/from-the-editor-technonationalism/?truid=26ed320dce9b06b5f4e661f524e2c698&utm_source=the_download&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=the_download.unpaid.engagement&utm_term=non-subs&utm_content=08-21-2020
text.headline: FORESIGHT-A world divided into \xe2\x80\x9ccans\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9ccannots\xe2\x80\x9d | MIT Technology Review

text.text: Second charity reveals it was affected by the Blackbaud ransomware attack (Third Sector, July 27) UK/US - A national homelessness charity has said it was one of the charities whose data was stolen when hackers targeted the US-based cloud computing provider Blackbaud. The company was targeted by cybercriminals who accessed some of its client data, with national mental health charity Young Minds (https://youngminds.org.uk/)  caught up in the ransomware attack. Blackbaud is one of the largest providers of fundraising, financial management, and supporter management software to the UK charity sector.- Sources : https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/shin-bet-spied-on-israeli-civilians-for-years-without-knesset-approval-636451
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Shin Bet spied on civilians for years without Knesset approval - report - The Jerusalem Post

text.text: Shin Bet spied on civilians for years without Knesset approval - report (Jerusalem Post, July 27) Israel - While the Shin Bet's surveillance of cellphones to track Covid-19 patients has raised controversy, Channel 13 reported that Israel's internal security service has been spying on civilians' cell phones for years as part of a secret program to fight ISIS. The program, referred to as "Dark Box", used the automatic connection to the database of cellular companies to access civilians' phones.- Sources : https://www.thirdsector.co.uk/second-charity-reveals-affected-blackbaud-ransomware-attack/management/article/1690399
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Second charity reveals it was affected by the Blackbaud ransomware attack | Third Sector

text.text: Russia’s GRU hackers hit US government and energy targets (Wired, July 25) Russia/US - Russia's APT28 (or fancy Bear) has allegedly been hitting US networks, including intrusions that targeted government agencies and critical infrastructure. According to the FBI, the GRU hackers primarily attempted to break into victims’ mail servers, Microsoft Office 365 and email accounts, and VPN servers. Technical breadcrumbs included in the notice, reveal that APT28 also targeted the US energy sector.- Sources : https://www.wired.com/story/russia-fancy-bear-us-hacking-campaign-government-energy/#:~:text=From%20December%202018%20until%20at,May%20and%20obtained%20by%20WIRED.
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Instagram

text.text: Experts found targeted attacks by hackers from North Korea on Russia (E Hacking News, July 24) North Korea/Russia - Kaspersky revealed that the North Korean Lazarus  group has become active in Russia, attacking through apps for cryptocurrency traders in order to steal data for access to wallets and exchanges. In addition, the group is collecting information with a particular focus on the military-space, energy, and IT spheres. The interest in bitcoin can be explained by the need for North Korea  to bypass sanctions.- Sources : https://www.ehackingnews.com/2020/07/experts-found-targeted-attacks-by.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Experts found targeted attacks by hackers from North Korea on Russia - E Hacking News - Latest Hacker News and IT Security News

text.text: The group has been using the advanced MATA framework, which can hack a device regardless of the operating system — Windows, Linux or macOS.- Sources :
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: NSA/CISA joint report warns on attacks on critical industrial systems (Security Affairs, July 27) US - The NSA and CISA issued a warning (https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-205a) of cyberattacks targeting critical infrastructure across the US, stating that “cyber-actors have demonstrated their continued willingness to conduct malicious cyber-activity against critical infrastructure ... Due to the increase in adversary capabilities and activity, the criticality to US national security and way of life and the vulnerability of OT systems, civilian infrastructure makes attractive targets for foreign powers...”- Sources : https://securityaffairs.co/wordpress/106362/ics-scada/nsa-attacks-industrial-systems.html?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=nsa-attacks-industrial-systems
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-NSA/CISA joint report warns on attacks on critical industrial systemsSecurity Affairs

text.text: Fighting False News in Ukraine, Facebook Fact Checkers Tread a Blurry Line (New York Times, July 26) Ukraine - Facebook hired StopFake to help curb the flow of Russian propaganda and other false news across its platform in Ukraine. StopFake, like all Facebook’s outside fact checkers, signed a pledge (https://ifcncodeofprinciples.poynter.org/know-more/the-commitments-of-the-code-of-principles) to be nonpartisan. But in recent weeks, StopFake has been accused of ties to the Ukrainian far right and of bias in its fact-checking, raising questions for Facebook over whom it allows to separate truth from lies — and who is considered a neutral fact checker in a country at war.- Sources : https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/26/world/europe/ukraine-facebook-fake-news.html
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Fighting False News in Ukraine, Facebook Fact Checkers Tread a Blurry Line - The New York Times

text.text: UK and US say Russia fired a satellite weapon in space (BBC, July 23) Space - The US and UK accused Russia of testing a weapon-like projectile in space that could be used to target satellites in orbit. The US State Department described the use of the "in-orbit anti-satellite weaponry" as concerning. Russia, the UK, the US and China are among more than 100 nations to have committed to a space treaty that stipulates that outer space is to be explored by all and purely for peaceful purposes.- Sources : https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-53518238
text.headline: FORESIGHT-email

text.text: Memes, the pandemic and the new tactics of information warfare (BBC, July 23) Space - The COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated Russia's and China's adoption of their influence and disinformation tactics to the modern era, national security experts and military leaders say, leveraging US laws, social media platforms, and divisions within society to their larger strategic advantage.- Sources : https://www.c4isrnet.com/smr/information-warfare/2020/07/23/memes-the-pandemic-and-the-new-tactics-of-information-warfare/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+fifth-domain%2Fhome+%28Fifth+Domain+-+Arc+RSS+-+Home%29
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Memes, the pandemic and the new tactics of information warfare

text.text: “This crisis has made it very clear that Russia, China and others intend to strategically use cyber-enabled information operations against the US,” O’Brien, deputy chief of staff for intelligence, surveillance, reconnaissance and cyber effects operations, said.- Sources :
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Research shows human rights activists in India were targeted with spyware (CyberScoop, June 15) India - Human rights activists in India were targeted by a coordinated spyware campaign from January to October 2019, according to research (https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/research/2020/06/india-human-rights-defenders-targeted-by-a-coordinated-spyware-operation/) by Amnesty International and Citizen Lab. The targets were sent spearphishing emails with malicious links/files that would infect victims’ devices with spyware. Three of the activists were allegedly targeted by the NSO Group's Pegasus spyware.- Sources : https://www.cyberscoop.com/india-spyware-nso-group-amnesty-international-citizen-lab/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Human rights activists in India have been targeted by another spyware campaign

text.text: NHS Digital says over hundred NHSmail mailboxes hit by phishing attack (Government Computing, June 15) UK - According to NHS Digital, over a hundred NHSmail mailboxes were compromised through which phishing emails were later sent to external recipients. The incident took place between 30 May and 1 June and compromised 113 mailboxes. The agency said that there is no proof to indicate that patient records have been accessed.- Sources : https://www.governmentcomputing.com/security/digital-disruptions/nhsmail-mailboxes-phishing-attack
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-NHS Digital says over hundred NHSmail mailboxes hit by phishing attack

text.text: Earth Empusa threat group distributing Android 'ActionSpy' spyware to target minority group in Tibet and Turkey (Computing, June 15) China - Trend Micro identified (https://blog.trendmicro.com/trendlabs-security-intelligence/new-android-spyware-actionspy-revealed-via-phishing-attacks-from-earth-empusa/) a new spyware strain, being used by Chinese APT,  Earth Empusa, to collect data from Uighurs across Tibet, Turkey, and Taiwan. The spyware was first spotted in April 2020 but may date to 2017. Earth Empusa has a history of targeting members of minority groups. In 2018/2019, it sent malicious links via individually tailored WhatsApp messages to senior members of Tibetan groups, posing as NGO workers and journalists.- Sources : https://www.computing.co.uk/news/4016483/earth-empusa-threat-group-distributing-android-actionspy-spyware-target-minority-group-tibet-turkey
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: Israel and Greece plan cooperation on cyber security (YNet, June 16) Greece/Israel - The Israeli National Cyber Security Authority has signed a memorandum of intent for cooperation with the Greek Cybersecurity services. The planned cooperation comes at a time of increased tension between Turkey and Greece, which has spilled into cyberspace.- Sources : https://www.ynetnews.com/article/HkzHwLUa8
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Israel and Greece plan cooperation on cyber security

text.text: US ‘in talks’ to finance #5G in #Brazil and keep #Huawei out (EU Reporter, June 16) Brazil - The US is in talks with Brazil around financing its 5G infrastructure to lock Huawei out of the country’s 5G networks. The US ambassador to Brazil also said that the US was also looking to carry out similar financing “in other parts of the world”. The financing would be backed by the International Development Finance Corporation, created by the US in late 2018 to counter China’s international development projects.- Sources : https://www.eureporter.co/frontpage/2020/06/16/us-in-talks-to-finance-5g-in-brazil-and-keep-huawei-out/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: UK plans anti-Huawei 5G alliance (Scoop, June 14) UK - According to The Times, the UK plans to form an alliance of democratic nations to create a 5G alternative to Huawei. The group will include the G7 nations: Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the UK and the United States as well as Australia, South Korea and India.- Sources : https://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/HL2006/S00096/uk-plans-anti-huawei-5g-alliance.htm
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-UK plans anti-Huawei 5G alliance | Scoop News

text.text: Political Groups Track Protesters’ Cellphone Data (Wall Street Journal, June 14) US - Protests around the US are allegedly being used by advocacy and voter-registration groups to track and harvest data for their political ad campaigns. Tracking individuals through location data gathered by apps has  long been used by businesses and is now catching on among political groups.- Sources : https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-political-groups-are-harvesting-data-from-protesters-11592156142
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Cyber security pros don't think governments can protect election infrastructure from cyberattacks (ITPro Portal, June 15) Global - Cybersecurity experts doubt local governments can defend election infrastructure against domestic and international cyberattacks, according to a Venafi poll of 485 IT security professionals. 70% of respondents believe election infrastructure is at risk, with 75% seeing fake news as the most significant threat to the integrity of the upcoming US elections.- Sources : https://www.itproportal.com/news/most-security-pros-dont-think-governments-can-protect-election-infrastructure-from-cyberattacks/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Most security pros don\'t think governments can protect election infrastructure from cyberattacks | ITProPortal

text.text: Cybercriminals Appear to Back off From Coronavirus Scams (The Record, Aug 18) Global - COVID-19 themed phishing emails, aiming to capitalize on the public’s fears, have declined by 70% between May and July, according to data from the Recorded Future platform. Allegedly attackers have shifted their tactics in recent months likely because the emails stopped being effective as COVID-19 is “not something people are struggling to get information on anymore — it’s something we’re all living with.”- Sources : https://therecord.media/cybercriminals-appear-to-back-off-from-coronavirus-scams/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-None

text.text: US Army report says many North Korean hackers operate from abroad (ZDNet, Aug 18) North Korea - North Korea has at least 6,000 hackers and electronic warfare specialists working in its ranks, and many of these are operating abroad in countries such as Belarus, China, India, Malaysia, and Russia, a US Army report on "North Korean Tactics (http://www.documentcloud.org/documents/7038686-US-Army-report-on-North-Korean-military.html) " said. The report contains a treasure trove of information about the Korean People's Army, e.g. military tactics, weapons arsenal, leadership structure, troop types, logistics, and electronic warfare capabilities.- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/us-army-report-says-many-north-korean-hackers-operate-from-abroad/#ftag=RSSbaffb68
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-US Army report says many North Korean hackers operate from abroad | ZDNet

text.text: Ex-IDF Intelligence official: Russian cyber, disinformation trends converge with vaccine (The Jerusalem Post, Aug 17) Russia - Russia is using cyber and disinformation to bolster its standing regarding everything surrounding the issue of a coronavirus vaccine, former IDF Intelligence officer, Daniel Rakov said. Putin is interested in depicting his country as winning the vaccine race and is using hacking and social-media campaigns to discredit competing vaccines.- Sources : https://www.jpost.com/international/ex-idf-intelligence-official-russian-cyber-disinformation-trends-converge-with-vaccine-638977
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Ex-IDF Intelligence official: Russian cyber, disinformation trends converge with vaccine - The Jerusalem Post

text.text: No ‘Hoax’: Bipartisan Senate Report Confirms Russian 2016 Role, Putin Ordered DNC Hack, More (Forbes, Aug 18) Russia/US - Russian President Vladimir Putin directly ordered the hacking of the Democratic Party’s servers with the goal of leaking damaging information that would hurt then-candidate Hillary Clinton and provide a boost to President Trump’s campaign, the final report (https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/sites/default/files/documents/report_volume5.pdf)  from the Senate Intelligence Committee’s probe into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election found.- Sources : https://www.forbes.com/sites/jackbrewster/2020/08/18/putin-ordered-dnc-hack-bipartisan-senate-report-confirms/#39d815c4daec
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-No \xe2\x80\x98Hoax\xe2\x80\x99: Bipartisan Senate Report Confirms Russian 2016 Role, Putin Ordered DNC Hack, More

text.text: UCI cyber-physical security researchers highlight vulnerability of solar inverters (UCI News, Aug 18) Global - Cyber-physical systems security researchers from the University of California demonstrated (https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/barua) a spoofing mechanism that can disrupt a power grid using $50 worth of equipment tucked inside a disposable coffee cup. Al Faruque’s team (https://engineering.uci.edu/users/mohammad-al-faruque)  research exploitable loopholes in systems that combine hardware & software with machines and other infrastructure as well as invent new technologies that are better shielded against attacks.- Sources : https://news.uci.edu/2020/08/18/uci-cyber-physical-security-researchers-highlight-vulnerability-of-solar-inverters/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-UCI cyber-physical security researchers highlight vulnerability of solar inverters – UCI News

text.text: Hospitals Scramble to Adapt Security Measures Amid Cyberattacks (Wall Street Journal, June 26) Global - Hospitals and health-care systems are being forced to monitor their suppliers closely and institute specialized training for staff amid a surge in attempted cyberattacks, security chiefs say.- Sources : https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/25/us/politics/russia-ransomware-coronavirus-work-home.html?referringSource=articleShare (https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/25/us/politics/russia-ransomware-coronavirus-work-home.html?referringSource=articleShare.)
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Russian Criminal Group Finds New Target: Americans Working at Home - The New York Times

text.text: Russian Criminal Group Finds New Target: Americans Working at Home (New York Times, June 26) Russia/US - A hacking group calling itself Evil Corp., indicted in December, has shown up in corporate networks with sophisticated ransomware. American officials worry election infrastructure could be next.- Sources : https://www.meritalk.com/articles/krebs-calls-covid-19-biggest-driver-of-cyber-modernization/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Krebs Calls COVID-19 \xe2\x80\x98Biggest Driver\xe2\x80\x99 of Cyber Modernization – MeriTalk

text.text: Spyware hidden in Chinese tax software was probably planted by a nation-state, say experts (NBC News, June 25) China - Multinational technology vendors doing business in China are instructed by Chinese banks to install software to pay local taxes. The embedded inside the tax software are sophisticated pieces of malware, dubbed "GoldenSpy." gaving attackers complete access to the companyies' networks. According to the Trustwave report (https://www.trustwave.com/en-us/resources/library/documents/the-golden-tax-department-and-the-emergence-of-goldenspy-malware/?utm_source=sl-blog&utm_medium=banner&utm_campaign=goldenspy ) , the malware's sophistication, and the lack of an obvious financial payoff, appears to point to a nation-state as the culprit.- Sources : https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/security/spyware-hidden-chinese-tax-software-was-probably-planted-nation-state-n1231975?mod=djemCybersecruityPro&tpl=cy
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Spyware hidden in Chinese tax software was probably planted by a nation-state, say experts

text.text: India-China standoff: ITBP internal memo warns personnel of Chinese phishing attack (Business Today, June 25) India/China - CERT-ln has issued an advisory regarding a potential cyberattack from Chinese 'cyber warriors' against the  Indian Army. Phishing attacks are expected to impersonate various government agencies and military, supposedly in guise of general details like "free COVID-19 test", which could come from spoofed e-mail IDs like (ncov2019@gov.in).- Sources : https://panampost.com/sabrina-martin/2020/06/25/iran-trains-venezuelan-military/?cn-reloaded=1
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: A new US bill would ban the police use of facial recognition (MIT Technology Review, June 26) US - US Democratic lawmakers introduced a bill that would ban the use of facial recognition tech by federal law enforcement agencies. Specifically, it would make it illegal for any federal agency or official to “acquire, possess, access, or use” biometric surveillance technology in the US.- Sources : https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/06/26/1004500/a-new-us-bill-would-ban-the-police-use-of-facial-recognition/?truid=26ed320dce9b06b5f4e661f524e2c698&utm_source=the_download&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=the_download.unpaid.engagement&utm_term=non-subs&utm_content=06-26-2020
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-A new US bill would ban the police use of facial recognition | MIT Technology Review

text.text: Iran Trains Venezuelan Military to Control Communications (Panam Post, June 25) Iran/Venezuela - Iran reinforces its military influence over Venezuela. It now conducts courses for Venezuelan military personnel to train them in matters of propaganda and civil war. Iran has joined Cuba’s efforts to help Maduro in intelligence matters to further censor Venezuelans and implement further mechanisms of espionage and repression.- Sources :
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Medical Devices Among Most Risky to Security (Info Security, June 26) Global - Medical devices, physical access operations and networking equipment are among the most risky when it comes to risks posed to businesses. Forescout Device Cloud determined that the riskiest device groups include smart buildings, medical devices, networking equipment and VoIP phones. Forescout is witnessing an increase in the number and sophistication of vulnerabilities in medical devices and cyber-attacks on hospitals, although these rarely target medical devices directly.- Sources : https://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/news/medical-devices-risky/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Medical Devices Among Most Risky to Security - Infosecurity Magazine

text.text: UCSF Medical School Officials Pay Hackers $1.14 Million Ransom To Recover Stolen Data (CBS SF BayArea, June 28) US - The University of California at San Francisco School of Medicine paid over $1 million to hackers so researchers could regain access to encrypted data. The security incident occurred on June 1 and left a number of servers” inaccessible. While the ransomware attack affected academic "serving the public good," it did not affect patient care and its coronavirus work.- Sources : https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/delhi-health-mission-website-hacked/article31940198.ece
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-None

text.text: J&K Power Dept Comes Under Cyber Attack, 4 Servers Hit (Kashmir Observer, June 27) India - A cyberattack was launched on the servers of the Jammu and Kashmir Power Development Department (JKPDD) but the threat has been contained. The cyber threat was detected on June 24 on 4 out of 103 servers installed across JKPDD at Data Center (DC) and Disaster Recovery Center (DRC).- Sources : https://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2020/06/28/cyber-attack-ucsf-medical-school-ransom/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-UCSF Medical School Officials Pay Hackers $1.14 Million Ransom To Recover Stolen Data – CBS San Francisco

text.text: Coronavirus | Hackers get data of 80,000 COVID-19 patients in Delhi (The Hindu, June 28) India - The website of the Delhi State Health Mission (dshm.delhi.gov.in) has been taken down temporarily on Sunday after a group of hackers exposed its vulnerability. They hacked the website and accessed personal data of more than 80,000 COVID-19 patients in Delhi. Personal data of more than 80,000 corona positive patients, cured and active, in Delhi could potentially be at risk as a result of hacking. The group has, however, claimed that it merely wanted to highlight the vulnerability of the data system through hacking.- Sources :
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-None

text.text: An Egyptian cyber attack on Ethiopia by hackers is the latest strike over the Grand Dam (Quartz Africa, June 27) Egypt/Ethiopia - In an extension of a bilateral dispute between Ethiopia and Egypt over the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam being built on the Nile River, Egyptian hackers launched a cyberattack on Ethiopian government websites. The hackers, claimed to belong to the “Cyber_Horus Group” and left messages threatening war over the Nile and a “Pharaonic curse” upon Ethiopians.- Sources : https://qz.com/africa/1874343/egypt-cyber-attack-on-ethiopia-is-strike-over-the-grand-dam/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Egypt cyber attack on Ethiopia is strike over the Grand Dam \xe2\x80\x94 Quartz Africa

text.text: Chinese state media accuses Australia of spying and feeding 'fake news' to media (SBS News, June 29) Australia/China - China's state media has claimed Australia is ramping up spying efforts against Beijing as diplomatic ties come under heavy pressure. The Chinese Communist Party-run Global Times tabloid accuses Australia of waging an intensifying espionage offensive through sending spies to China. It also claims Australia is instigating defections, spying on Chinese students and feeding "fake news" to the media to hype up theories about Chinese spying.- Sources : https://www.sbs.com.au/news/chinese-state-media-accuses-australia-of-spying-and-feeding-fake-news-to-media
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Chinese state media accuses Australia of spying and feeding 'fake news' to media | SBS News

text.text: Chinese malware used in attacks against Australian orgs (BleepingComputer, June 28) Australia/China - The Australian government released an advisory about increased cyber activity from a state actor against networks belonging to its agencies and companies in the country. Behind the attack is a “sophisticated” adversary that relies on slightly modified proof-of-concept exploit code for yesteryear vulnerabilities, the government says. An unofficial blame finger points to China.- Sources : https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/chinese-malware-used-in-attacks-against-australian-orgs/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Chinese malware used in attacks against Australian orgs

text.text: Indian government looks to ban Chinese vendors like Huawei and ZTE from participating in 5G trails (The Indian Wire, June 27) India/China - As India-China relations worsen, India has decided to assess the participation of Chinese vendors (e.g Huawei & ZTE) in India’s 5G network. A committee will be formed to look into this matter which includes members from the Department of telecommunications, Intelligence Bureau and National Security Council Secretariat.- Sources : https://www.theindianwire.com/business/indian-government-looks-to-ban-chinese-vendors-like-huawei-and-zte-from-participating-in-5g-trails-275685/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: China: National security law for Hong Kong risks turning city into police state (Amnesty International, June 28) China - China’s national security law for Hong Kong will put everybody in the city at risk of arbitrary detention and unfair trial unless underpinned by measures to guarantee protection of human rights, Amnesty International said. Chinese authorities are expected to vote through the law at the upcoming National People’s Congress Standing Committee extraordinary session – which runs from today until Tuesday 30 June – despite having not yet publicly disclosed its full details.- Sources : https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2020/06/china-national-security-law-for-hong-kong-risks-turning-city-into-police-state/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-China: National security law for Hong Kong risks turning city into police state | Amnesty International

text.text: DDoS attack on online voting system registered on Saturday - mayor’s office (TASS, June 27) Russia - A DDoS attack through an observer service on the system of online voting on amendments to Russia’s Constitution was registered on Saturday night, but failed to entail any disruptions, and the online votes will be counted, Artem Kostyrko, head of the department for improvement of territorial administration and the development of Moscow government’s smart projects, told TASS. Attacks on elections are becoming a global talking point amid the digitisation of elections.- Sources : https://tass.com/politics/1172393
text.headline: FORESIGHT-DDoS attack on online voting system registered on Saturday - mayor\xe2\x80\x99s office -  Russian Politics & Diplomacy - TASS

text.text: Senior clergy among Togo activists said targeted by Israeli spyware (Times of Israel, Aug 03) Togo/Israel - Two senior members of the Church were among a number of Togo anti-government activists who were targeted using software made by Israel’s NSO Group. A joint investigation by the Guardian and Le Monde revealed that Bishop Benoit Alowonou and 5 other critics of the government in the West African country were among those alerted by WhatsApp last year that their cellphones had been targeted. It was the first known case of the spyware being used on members of the clergy.- Sources : https://www.timesofisrael.com/senior-clergy-among-togo-activists-said-targeted-by-israeli-spyware/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Senior clergy among Togo activists said targeted by Israeli spyware | The Times of Israel

text.text: Hackers Broke Into Real News Sites to Plant Fake Stories (Wired, Aug 03) Eastern Europe - A new FireEye report (https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/07/ghostwriter-influence-campaign.html)  outlines a cyber-information campaign against Eastern European news outlets. The malicious actor, named as Ghostwriter, has been hacking the content management systems of legitimate news websites to post their own stories. These planted stories were then disseminated with spoofed emails, social media, and even op-eds the propagandists wrote on other sites that accept user-generated content. The aim of the campaign appears to be to undermine NATO and US troops in Poland and the Baltics.- Sources : https://www.wired.com/story/hackers-broke-into-real-news-sites-to-plant-fake-stories-anti-nato/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Instagram

text.text: Exclusive: Inside Hizbollah's fake news training camps sowing instability across the Middle East (The Telegraph, Aug 02) Lebanon - Hezbollah has allegedly been training “electronic armies” of social media activists across the Middle East to spread online disinformation and sow political unrest and violence in the region.- Sources : https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2020/08/02/exclusive-inside-hezbollahs-fake-news-training-camps-sowing/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-YouTube icon

text.text: Since 2012, Hezbollah has been providing training in the manipulation of photographs, management of large numbers of fake social media accounts, making of videos, avoiding Facebook censorship, and effectively spreading disinformation online.- Sources :
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: US govt exposes Chinese espionage malware secretly used since 2008 (Bleeping Computer, Aug 03) US/China - The US released information on a malware variant used by Chinese government-sponsored hackers in cyber espionage campaigns targeting governments, corporations, and think tanks. The new malware is a RAT dubbed TAIDOOR (https://www.us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/analysis-reports/ar20-216a)  actively used by Chinese government cyber actors according to the information published by the FBI, the CISA, and the Department of Defense.- Sources : https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/us-govt-exposes-chinese-espionage-malware-secretly-used-since-2008/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-US govt exposes Chinese espionage malware secretly used since 2008

text.text: EU sanctions China, Russia, and North Korea for past hacks (ZDNet, July 30) EU/China/Russia/North Korea - The EU has imposed sanctions against China, Russia, and North Korea for past cyber-attacks carried out against European citizens and businesses, sanctioning:- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/eu-sanctions-china-russia-and-north-korea-for-past-hacks/#ftag=RSSbaffb68
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-EU sanctions China, Russia, and North Korea for past hacks | ZDNet

text.text: China for Operation Cloud Hopper (https://us-cert.cisa.gov/sites/default/files/publications/Chinese-Cyber-Activity-Targeting-Managed-Service-Providers.pdf)  -- a series of intrusions against cloud providers- Sources : https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/07/teen-arrested-mastermind-twitter-hack-200731191507910.html
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Three men charged in connection with celebrity Twitter hack |  News | Al Jazeera

text.text: Russia for NotPetya (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petya_(malware))- Sources :

text.text: Russia for an attempted cyber-attack on the OPCW (https://www.government.nl/latest/news/2018/10/04/netherlands-defence-intelligence-and-security-service-disrupts-russian-cyber-operation-targeting-opcw)- Sources :
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Ransomware feared as possible saboteur for US November elections (The Manichi, Aug 03) US - Federal authorities say one of the gravest threats to the November election is a well-timed ransomware attack that could paralyze voting operations. The threat isn't just from foreign governments, but any fortune-seeking criminal.- Sources : https://mainichi.jp/english/articles/20200803/p2g/00m/0fe/033000c
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Ransomware feared as possible saboteur for US November election - The Mainichi

text.text: Ransomware against state and local governments have been on the rise, with criminals seeking quick money by seizing data and holding it hostage. Even if a ransomware attack fails to disrupt elections, it could nonetheless rattle confidence in the vote.- Sources : https://www.healthcareitnews.com/news/north-america/himsscast-covid-19-spurred-rapid-tech-adoptions-might-open-door-cybersecurity
text.headline: FORESIGHT-HIMSSCast: COVID-19-spurred rapid tech adoptions might open the door to cybersecurity threats | Healthcare IT News

text.text: TikTok Becomes Latest Battleground in the US-China Cold War (Morocco World News, Aug 01) Global - Amid escalating tensions with China, US President Trump says he will use his executive power or emergency economic powers to ban TikTok from operating in the US. “As far as TikTok is concerned, we’re banning them from the United States,” Trump (https://www.moroccoworldnews.com/2020/07/313092/donald-trump-us-looks-forward-to-continuing-fruitful-work-with-morocco/)  told reporters on July 31.- Sources :
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: - Sources :
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Zimbabwe’s new cyber law to target online government and military critics (The Standard, July 12) Zimbabwe - Zimbabwe could sanction the search for government critics online, thanks to a planned cyber-security law earmarked to make it an offence to spread falsehoods and deal with leakage of official information on social media and the internet. The Cyber Security and Data Protection Bill could empower the military to spy on citizens online.- Sources : https://www.thestandard.co.zw/2020/07/12/zimbabwes-new-cyber-law-to-target-online-government-and-military-critics/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Zimbabwe\xe2\x80\x99s new cyber law to target online government and military critics | The Standard

text.text: China's Great Firewall descends on Hong Kong internet users (The Guardian, July 08) China - Last Tuesday, the Great Firewall of China appeared to descend on Hong Kong. As part of a contentious new national security law, the Hong Kong government enabled police to censor online speech, force ISPs to hand over data, and shut down platforms. Many residents rushed to erase their digital footprint of any signs of dissent or support for last year protests. Hong Kong is facing a dramatic decline of one of its most important advantages – a free and open internet.- Sources : https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jul/08/china-great-firewall-descends-hong-kong-internet-users
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-China\'s Great Firewall descends on Hong Kong internet users | World news | The Guardian

text.text: Azerbaijani hackers obtained information from the Armenian Ministry of Defense (E Hacking News, July 13) Armenia/Azerbaijan - Passport data of Armenian citizens and documents related to military units was leaked by alleged Azerbaijani hackers. Previously, PII of Armenian citizens infected with the coronavirus had been leaked. It is believed that the hackers get access to the data mainly through email, taking advantage of the low level of computer literacy of the Armenian population.- Sources : https://www.ehackingnews.com/2020/07/azerbaijani-hackers-obtained.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Azerbaijani hackers obtained information from the Armenian Ministry of Defense - E Hacking News - Latest Hacker News and IT Security News

text.text: Israel court rejects calls to revoke NSO Group's spy software export licence (Middle East Eye, July 13) Israel - A Tel Aviv  court rejected a ruling to revoke the export license of the NSO Group, whose software has reportedly been used by governments to spy on dissidents and human rights activists. The court ruled that Amnesty International and 30 human rights activists, who had filed the petition, failed to provide evidence that NSO's Pegasus software was used to spy on activists from the UK-based NGO.- Sources : https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/israel-pegasus-nso-group-spy-software-licence-revoke-rejected
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Russian hacker found guilty for Dropbox, LinkedIn, and Formspring breaches (ZDNet, July 11) US/Russia - A jury found Russian hacker, Yevgeniy Nikulin, guilty for breaching the internal networks of LinkedIn, Dropbox, and Formspring back in 2012 and then selling their user databases on the black market.  Authorities started an investigation after the three companies filed criminal complaints in California, in 2015. Nikulin was then arrested in 2016 while vacationing in Prague with his girlfriend.- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/russian-hacker-found-guilty-for-dropbox-linkedin-and-formspring-breaches/#ftag=RSSbaffb68
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Russian hacker found guilty for Dropbox, LinkedIn, and Formspring breaches | ZDNet

text.text: Dark Basin: Uncovering a Massive Hack-For-Hire Operation (Citizen Lab, June 09) Global - Citizen Lab uncovered an India-based hack-for-hire group, Dark Basin, targeting advocacy groups, journalists, and governments in six continents. Dark Basin extensively targeted US nonprofits and organisations working on net neutrality. Citizen Lab notified many of the victims, providing assistance where possible.- Sources : https://citizenlab.ca/2020/06/dark-basin-uncovering-a-massive-hack-for-hire-operation/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Dark Basin: Uncovering a Massive Hack-For-Hire Operation - The Citizen Lab

text.text: Life Healthcare Group takes its systems offline after cyber attack (The South African, June 09) South Africa - Due to a cyberattack, the Life Healthcare Group’s hospitals and administrative offices have had to switch over to manual processing systems. The Life Healthcare Group acted immediately and took its systems offline, in order to actively contain the attack. The extent of the compromise is unknown. Life Healthcare's CEO, Pieter Van Der Westhuizen, expressed his disappointment over criminals willingness to attack facilities involved in the COVID response.- Sources : https://www.thesouthafrican.com/news/life-healthcare-group-hacked-cyber-attack-systems-offline/
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Life Healthcare Group takes its systems offline after cyber attack

text.text: Honda paused production due to cyberattack (Dark Reading, June 09) Global - Honda confirmed that a cyberattack has disrupted its internal network and forced a temporary suspension of production and vehicle shipments at some of its factories around the world. The incident affected Honda's ability to make use of its internal systems, including its ability to use email services and access servers. Some reports (https://www.reuters.com/article/us-honda-cyber/honda-hit-by-cyber-attack-some-production-disrupted-idUSKBN23G1CI)  point to ransomware, though there are no details on the malware used.- Sources : https://www.darkreading.com/attacks-breaches/honda-pauses-production-due-to-cyberattack/d/d-id/1338029?_mc=rss_x_drr_edt_aud_dr_x_x-rss-simple
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-None

text.text: IBM will no longer offer, develop, or research facial recognition technology (The Verge, June 09) US - In a letter to Congress (https://www.ibm.com/blogs/policy/facial-recognition-susset-racial-justice-reforms/) , IBM stated that it will no longer offer nor develop general purpose facial recognition/analysis software. The letter said that IBM "will not condone uses of any technology, including facial recognition technology ... for mass surveillance, racial profiling, violations of basic human rights and freedoms. [IBM] believe[s] now is the time to begin a national dialogue on whether and how facial recognition technology should be employed by domestic law enforcement agencies.”- Sources : https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/8/21284683/ibm-no-longer-general-purpose-facial-recognition-analysis-software
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Vox Media

text.text: LAPD Got Tech Demos from Israeli Phone Hacking Firm NSO Group (VICE, June 09) US - The LAPD met with employees of the controversial NSO Group, receiving a demo of the company's powerful phone hacking technology, according to  Motherboard. The NSO Group has been attempting to move into the US market. The NSO Group is infamous for selling its Pegasus spyware to authoritarian regimes, such as, Saudi Arabia, which used  it to monitor associates of Jamal Khashoggi.- Sources : https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/n7wna7/lapd-phone-hacking-nso-group-westbridge
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-VICE

text.text: Mobile phishing rises by 37% in Q1 2020 (IT Security Guru, June 09) US - A new Mobile Phishing Spotlight Report (https://www.lookout.com/phishing-spotlight-report-lp?utm_source=BL&utm_medium=BL&utm_campaign=WW-MU-MU-MU-MU-P_NON-Spotlight_Blog)  claims that mobile phishing increased by 37% from Q4 2019 to Q1 2020 as cybercriminals target millions working from home. With more sensitive data and information being transferred through mobile phone devices, these have become a favourable target for cybercriminals.- Sources : https://www.itsecurityguru.org/2020/06/09/mobile-phishing-rises-by-37-in-q1-2020/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Mobile phishing rises by 37% in Q1 2020 - IT Security Guru

text.text: How Telegram Users Found A Way Through Belarus's Internet Lockdown (RFERL, Aug 12) Belarus - On the morning of Belarus' disputed presidential election (Aug 09), Internet-freedom advocacy group, NetBlocks, reported (https://netblocks.org/reports/internet-disruption-hits-belarus-on-election-day-YAE2jKB3) significant disruption of internet connectivity. Despite this chokehold, the cloud-based messaging service - Telegram, largely continued to function and became an invaluable tool for an amorphous opposition and citizens seeking information and coordination.- Sources : https://abcnews.go.com/Technology/wireStory/reports-sharp-increase-cybercrime-pandemic-72228287
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-UN reports sharp increase in cybercrime during pandemic - ABC News

text.text: Israel says it fended off North Korean hack attempt against defense industry (Times of Israel, Aug 13) Israel/North Korea - The Defense Ministry said hackers linked to North Korea's Lazarus Group targeted Israeli defense officials, luring them with fake job offers in a failed attempt to gain access to the databases of the country’s top defense industries.- Sources : https://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-says-it-fended-off-north-korean-hack-attempt-against-defense-industry/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Israel says it fended off North Korean hack attempt against defense industry | The Times of Israel

text.text: Cyber attack by India on mobiles of govt officials: ISPR (Daily Times, Aug 12) Pakistan/India - Pakistan’s Intelligence Agencies identified a major Indian cyberattack against personal devices of government officials and military personnel. Pakistan Army enhanced necessary measures to thwart such activities including action against violators of standing operating procedures (SOPs) on cyber security.- Sources : https://dailytimes.com.pk/653011/cyber-attack-by-india-on-mobiles-of-govt-officials-ispr/
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Cyber attack by India on mobiles of govt officials: ISPR

text.text: NSA, FBI expose Russian intelligence hacking tool: report (Reuters, Aug 13) US/Russia - The NSA and FBI exposed a sophisticated hacking tool (Drovorub) of Russia’s GRU. Drovorub can break into Linux, which is used throughout US National Security Systems and the larger cybersecurity community.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-cyber-russia/nsa-fbi-expose-russian-intelligence-hacking-tool-report-idUSKCN2592HY#:~:text=(Reuters)%20%2D%20The%20U.S.%20National,Russia's%20arsenal%20of%20digital%20weapons.
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- NSA, FBI expose Russian intelligence hacking tool: report - Reuters

text.text: The public call-out is unique because of the direct attribution to a specific Russian intelligence team - the 85th Main Special Service Center (GTsSS), military unit 26165.- Sources : https://www.bloombergquint.com/business/china-s-huawei-zte-set-to-be-shut-out-of-india-s-5g-trials#:~:text=(Bloomberg)%20%2D%2D%20China's%20Huawei%20Technologies,low%20following%20deadly%20border%20clashes.
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: China’s Huawei, ZTE Set To Be Shut Out of India’s 5G Trials (Bloomberg, Aug 13) India/China - Huawei and ZTE are set to be kept out of India’s 5G network plans as relations between the two countries hit a four decade low. India will apply investment rules, amended July 23, that cite national security concerns to restrict bidders from nations it shares land borders with. India’s decision echoes actions by the US, UK and Australia, which raised concerns about the companies’ government links.- Sources :
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Quantum communication takes a major leap with satellite-based experiment (Space, Aug 12) US -  Researchers have developed a new and improved protocol for quantum communication, using low-orbit satellites to send encrypted messages to ground-based stations. This improved mechanism could revolutionize how sensitive data is shared, protecting information during a time of increasing cybersecurity threats.- Sources : https://www.space.com/quantum-communication-major-leap-satellite-experiment.html
text.headline: FORESIGHT-space

text.text: Exiled Thai activist abducted in Cambodia, HRW says (Reuters, June 05) Cambodia - According to Human Rights Watch, Thai activist, Wanchalearm Satsaksit, was abducted in Cambodia amid a series of disappearances of exiled Southeast Asian dissidents. Wanchalearm fled Thailand after authorities summoned him following the 2014 coup. Thai authorities issued an arrest warrant for him for violating the Computer Crime Act by operating a Facebook page criticising the military government from abroad.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-cambodia-thailand-disappearance/exiled-thai-activist-abducted-in-cambodia-rights-group-says-idUSKBN23C0I0?feedType=RSS&feedName=worldNews
text.headline: ASSISTANCE- Exiled Thai activist abducted in Cambodia, rights group says - Reuters

text.text: Chinese Hackers Target Email Accounts of Biden Campaign Staff, Google Says (New York Times, June 04) China/US - Google stated that Chinese hackers are targeting the email accounts of campaign staff members working for Joe Biden, while confirming prior reports that Iran has targeted President Trump's campaign. The attacks appear to be conventional spear-phishing attacks, similar to the Russian breach of John Podesta’s emails in 2016, when he was Hillary Clinton’s campaign chairman.- Sources : https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/04/us/politics/china-joe-biden-hackers.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Chinese Hackers Target Email Accounts of Biden Campaign Staff, Google Says - The New York Times

text.text: Hackers targeting UK research labs amid vaccine race – GCHQ chief (The Guardian, June 04) China/UK - The UK's GCHQ is working to prevent hackers from hostile states, including China (https://www.theguardian.com/world/china) , trying to steal the secrets of a potential coronavirus vaccine. Head of GCHQ, Jeremy Fleming, said hackers were targeting the UK’s health infrastructure and some of its world-leading research labs. Britain’s intelligence agencies have been pressing for both a reassessment of the UK’s relationship with Beijing, arguing that Britain needs to reduce its dependence on Chinese technology and medical supplies.- Sources : https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2020/jun/04/hackers-targeting-uk-research-labs-amid-vaccine-race-gchq-chief
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Hackers targeting UK research labs amid vaccine race \xe2\x80\x93 GCHQ chief | UK news | The Guardian

text.text: Pro-Kremlin Outlets in the Crosshairs as Facebook Starts Labeling State Media (New York Times, June 04) Russia - Facebook has started labelling media organizations under the influence of governments and will begin blocking ads from those outlets. Facebook faced scrutiny for failing to stem foreign interference in the 2016 US election and amid debate over it handles misinformation and inflammatory statements. Kremlin-funded RT and Sputnik are among the outlets that will receive labels as well as the RIA Novosti news agency.- Sources : https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2020/06/05/pro-kremlin-outlets-in-the-crosshairs-as-facebook-starts-labeling-state-media-a70486
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Pro-Kremlin Outlets in the Crosshairs as Facebook Starts Labeling State Media - The Moscow Times

text.text: Facebook deactivates accounts of Tunisian political bloggers and activists (The Guardian, June 04) Tunisia - Facebook accounts of several high-profile bloggers and activists in Tunisia were deactivated without warning over the weekend. At least 14 accounts have since been restored after they contacted the Tunisian anti-corruption watchdog, IWatch (https://www.iwatch.tn/ar/) . Many people credited Facebook for providing a rallying point for activists and bloggers during Tunisia's 2011 revolution.- Sources : https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2020/jun/04/facebook-deactivates-accounts-of-tunisian-political-bloggers-and-activists
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Facebook deactivates accounts of Tunisian political bloggers and activists | Global development | The Guardian

text.text: Rising cyberattacks threaten real-world war (Asia Times, June 05) Global -  When Iran cyberattacked Israel’s water supply in late April, it did more than just shut down computers and disrupt water system operations but also intended to release poisonous chlorine into Israel’s water delivery infrastructure. Thus, Israel regards the attack as unprecedented.- Sources : https://asiatimes.com/2020/06/rising-cyberattacks-threaten-real-world-war/
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Rising cyberattacks threaten real-world war - Asia Times

text.text: FireEye- Sources :
