text.text: determined (https://www.pcrisk.com/internet-threat-news/13926-fireeye-links-triton-malware-to-russian-research-institute)  that the malware came out of Russia, hinting that Russia shared it with Iranian government hackers. The attack was routed through servers in Europe and the United States to try to hide its origin.- Sources :
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Disinformation Muddles Transnistrian Conflict Resolution (Institute for War and Peace Reporting, Aug 26) Moldova/Transnistria - In Moldova, the COVID-19 related informational crisis has further endangered attempts to resolve the Transnistrian conflict as Transnistrian media sources accuse Moldova of hindering humanitarian aid to the Transnistrian region during the coronavirus crisis. Despite the accusations being false, they were used by the Transnistrian region’s local authorities to justify the installation of 37 new and illegal checkpoints around the security zone.- Sources : https://iwpr.net/global-voices/disinformation-muddles-transnistrian-conflict
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-Disinformation Muddles Transnistrian Conflict Resolution | Institute for War and Peace Reporting

text.text: Russian arrested for trying to recruit an insider and hack a Nevada company (ZDNet, Aug 26) US/Russia - The US DoJ announced (http://www.documentcloud.org/documents/7044253-Egor-Igorevich-Kriuchkov-criminal-complaint.html) charges against a Russian citizen, aiming to pay an employee of a Nevada company $1,000,000 to install malware on its network. The accused was part of a criminal gang, which planned to steal sensitive documents to extort the company. To mask the theft, the group would launch DDoS attacks. The plans were upended when the employee reported the incident to the FBI.- Sources : https://www.zdnet.com/article/russian-arrested-for-trying-to-recruit-an-insider-and-hack-a-nevada-company/#ftag=RSSbaffb68
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Russian arrested for trying to recruit an insider and hack a Nevada company | ZDNet

text.text: How to Compete in Cyberspace: Cyber Command’s New Approach (Foreign Affairs, Aug 25) Canada/China - US Cyber Command has adopted a more proactive strategy to counter online threats, called "persistent engagement." In 2019, US Cyber Command was invited by Montenegro to investigate hacking of government networks, providing an opportunity to improve US cyber defenses ahead of the 2020 election. By disclosing its findings to the US government large antivirus companies, such hunt forward missions help to reduce the future effectiveness of the exposed malware and MOs.- Sources : https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/united-states/2020-08-25/cybersecurity
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Foreign Affairs

text.text: Israel ducks blame for firm with ex-intel officers that bid to ‘shape’ US vote (Times of Israel, Aug 25) Israel/US/Russia - In response to US accusations (https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/sites/default/files/documents/report_volume5.pdf) against Israeli firm, Psy-Group, of attempting to meddle in US elections on behalf of a Russian agent, Israel’s Defense Ministry said it is not aware of the firm's activities and does not consider itself responsible for regulating them. Several Psy-Group’s employees were graduates of Israeli intelligence units and Israel’s export control legislation bars firms from exporting intelligence knowledge & services without a license.- Sources : https://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-ducks-blame-for-firm-with-ex-intel-officers-that-bid-to-meddle-in-us-vote/
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-Israel ducks blame for firm with ex-intel officers that bid to 'shape' US vote | The Times of Israel

text.text: Canada has effectively moved to block China's Huawei from 5G, but can't say so (Reuters, Aug 25) Canada/China - Canada is the only member of the Five Eyes intelligence-sharing network that has not formally blocked Huawei from 5G networks, but it has effectively done just that, delaying a decision long enough to force telecom companies to exclude the Chinese gear maker. The strategy allows Canada to keep on the right side of both China and the United States as they tussle over Huawei.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-canada-huawei-analysis/canada-has-effectively-moved-to-block-chinas-huawei-from-5g-but-cant-say-so-idUSKBN25L26S
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- Canada has effectively moved to block China\'s Huawei from 5G, but can\'t say so - Reuters

text.text: Deep Fake: Setting the Stage for Next-Gen Social Engineering (Dark Reading, Aug 26) Global - The rise of business email compromise and advancement in social engineering techniques (e.g. spear phishing) may be further augmented by advancements in deep fake technology, which uses deep learning and AI to create, edit, or modify content such as video, audio, or photo artefacts.- Sources : https://www.darkreading.com/attacks-breaches/deep-fake-setting-the-stage-for-next-gen-social-engineering/a/d-id/1338680?_mc=rss_x_drr_edt_aud_dr_x_x-rss-simple
text.headline: FORESIGHT-None

text.text: Armenian NSS issues statement on leakage of data of COVID-19 patients and their contacts (News.Am, June 13) Armenia/Azerbaijan - The Armenian National Security Service (NSS) issued a statement on the data leak of 3,500 COVID-19 patients and persons in contact with them, claiming they were released by Azerbaijani hackers.- Sources : https://news.am/eng/news/585177.html
text.headline: ASSISTANCE-None

text.text: Honda Hackers May Have Used Tools Favored by Countries (New York Times, June 15) Japan - Last week's attack on Honda may have been performed by cyberweapons, previously only known to be used by state agents. The malware, which forced Honda to shut factories across the globe, was designed to attack the control systems for a wide variety of industrial facilities like factories and power plants.- Sources : https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/12/business/ransomware-honda-hacking-factories.html
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Honda Hackers May Have Used Tools Favored by Countries - The New York Times

text.text: Anonymous Hackers Target U.S. Police Again: ‘No More Impunity’ (Forbes, June 15) US - Social media accounts ,allegedly affiliated with Anonymous, claim an attack on the Atlanta Police Department website. However, attribution of such attacks remains a challenge as there is no organized Anonymous hacking group — it is a loose affiliation of like-minded individuals with a wide range of affiliated websites and social media accounts.- Sources : https://www.forbes.com/sites/zakdoffman/2020/06/15/anonymous-hackers-just-targeted-us-police-again-no-more-impunity/#8d0fed544e46
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Anonymous Hackers Target U.S. Police Again: \xe2\x80\x98No More Impunity\xe2\x80\x99

text.text: Greece recruits hackers against Turkish cyber attacks (News.Am, June 15) Greece/Turkey - Greece’s national intelligence service allegedly recruited 80 hackers amid a resurgence of cyberattacks by Turkish actors. Earlier this year, a Turkish group, calling themselves Anka Soldiers, targeted websites of Greek institutions after Greece's stance against Turkey’s interests in Libya hardened.- Sources : https://ahvalnews.com/turkey-greece/greece-recruits-hackers-against-turkish-cyber-attacks
text.headline: ACCOUNTABILITY-Greece recruits hackers against Turkish cyber attacks | Ahval

text.text: After IBM and Amazon, Microsoft bans facial recognition sales to police (Computing, June 12) US - Microsoft has become the latest tech firm to bar the use of its facial recognition technology by police. Brad Smith announced that the company would not sell its facial recognition software to police departments until there is a national law to regulate the use of the controversial technology. Microsoft also plans to bring in "review factors" that would help to determine the use of the technology beyond law enforcement.- Sources : https://www.computing.co.uk/news/4016430/ibm-amazon-microsoft-bans-facial-recognition-sales-police
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT-None

text.text: Zoom hits political turbulence in Washington, Beijing; lobbyists ready (Reuters, June 12) US - Zoom continues to  find itself in political battles between Washington and Beijing over its alleged ties with the latter. After a recent backlash over Zoom's suspension of activist accounts at China's request, it has begun hiring several lobbyists, including a former Trump campaign official and a former White House official.- Sources : https://www.reuters.com/article/us-zoom-video-commn-privacy-china/chinese-users-saw-zoom-as-a-window-through-the-great-firewall-idUSKBN23J1TE?feedType=RSS&feedName=technologyNews
text.headline: ADVANCEMENT- Chinese users saw Zoom as a window through the \'Great Firewall\' - Reuters

text.text: Facebook just released a database of 100,000 deepfakes to teach AI how to spot them (MIT Technology Review, June 12) Global - With tools for making deepfakes becoming widely available, many worry that they will be used to spread misinformation. While a DeepTrace Labs report (https://deeptracelabs.com/mapping-the-deepfake-landscape/)  states that deepfakes have not been used in disinformation campaigns yet, the number of deepfakes posted online was growing quickly. To address the problem, Facebook  is releasing the largest ever data set of deepfakes⁠ ( over100,000 clips produced using 3,426 actors) to train AI to spot manipulated videos.- Sources : https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/06/12/1003475/facebooks-deepfake-detection-challenge-neural-network-ai/?truid=26ed320dce9b06b5f4e661f524e2c698&utm_source=the_download&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=the_download.unpaid.engagement&utm_term=non-subs&utm_content=06-15-2020
text.headline: FORESIGHT-Facebook just released a database of 100,000 deepfakes to teach AI how to spot them | MIT Technology Review
